A Broken Promise (1-2).name: 残破誓言 A Broken Promise (1-2)
A Broken Promise (1-2).disable: @Check[occultism|dc:18] (受训)或@Check[religion|dc:18] (受训) 以告慰林地中讲述过往的精魂。
A Broken Promise (1-2).hazarddescription: 由于它所保护的地区受到死灵能量的侵蚀，神圣林地已经变得支离破碎，饱受折磨。它显现出一个幻象，警告其他人该地区的危险，并恳求帮助。法拉丝玛牧师和开拓者塞德里克·德拉斯顿被邪恶的腐蚀击败并侵染后，他闯入林地，玷污了中心的猎神雕像，照亮丛林的圣光消退了，露出了上方的黑色天空。从附近的塔中发出的紫色魔法能量渗入了神圣林地，被圣地所保护的生命随之死去。
A Broken Promise (1-2).reset: 林地每10分钟重复一次它的故事。此作祟会在重新对圣地神像进行祭祀后消散。但只要没能打败黑色瞭望塔中的邪恶力量，这种祭祀就是无法实现的。

Vision of Desecration.name: 亵渎异象 Vision of Desecration
Vision of Desecration.description:
触发 至少两个生物进入林地；

效果 作祟林地生成了一个被绝望侵蚀的幻象，重复法拉丝玛牧师堕落为亡灵的情景，以及他随后对圣地的亵渎，使死灵的能量在林中蔓延。所有在林地内的生物都必须尝试@Check[will|dc:18]豁免。

大成功 生物看懂了幻象，并且在1小时内对此作祟免疫。

成功 生物未因这个冲击性情报而遭受影响。

失败 生物体会到神圣林地因塞德里克的堕落而遭受的痛苦，作祟造成@Damage[2d6[mental]]伤害。

大失败 同失败，此外生物产生了对他人挥之不去的怀疑，24小时内无法因协助动作而受益。

A Broken Promise (3-4).name: 残破誓言 A Broken Promise (3-4)
A Broken Promise (3-4).disable: @Check[occultism|dc:22] (受训)或@Check[religion|dc:22] (受训) 以告慰林地中讲述过往的精魂。
A Broken Promise (3-4).hazarddescription: 由于它所保护的地区受到死灵能量的侵蚀，神圣林地已经变得支离破碎，饱受折磨。它显现出一个幻象，警告其他人该地区的危险，并恳求帮助。法拉丝玛牧师和开拓者塞德里克·德拉斯顿被邪恶的腐蚀击败并侵染后，他闯入林地，玷污了中心的猎神雕像，照亮丛林的圣光消退了，露出了上方的黑色天空。从附近的塔中发出的紫色魔法能量渗入了神圣林地，被圣地所保护的生命随之死去。
A Broken Promise (3-4).reset: 林地每10分钟重复一次它的故事。此作祟会在重新对圣地神像进行祭祀后消散。但只要没能打败黑色瞭望塔中的邪恶力量，这种祭祀就是无法实现的。

Vision of Desecration.name: 亵渎异象 Vision of Desecration
Vision of Desecration.description:
触发 至少两个生物进入林地；

效果 作祟林地生成了一个被绝望侵蚀的幻象，重复法拉丝玛牧师堕落为亡灵的情景，以及他随后对圣地的亵渎，使死灵的能量在林中蔓延。所有在林地内的生物都必须尝试@Check[will|dc:22]豁免。

大成功 生物看懂了幻象，并且在1小时内对此作祟免疫。

成功 生物未因这个冲击性情报而遭受影响。

失败 生物体会到神圣林地因塞德里克的堕落而遭受的痛苦，作祟造成@Damage[4d6[mental]]伤害。

大失败 同失败，此外生物产生了对他人挥之不去的怀疑，24小时内无法因协助动作而受益。

Animated Leather Armor.name: 活化皮甲 Animated Leather Armor
Animated Leather Armor.publicNotes:
一副活化盔甲通常都会当做守卫，或是被那些能够负担得起这种高昂花费的高端战斗学院作为陪练。它们最常见于法师的实验室和远古的地城之中。

通过某些仪式或是其他怪异的魔法，一些物品被赋予了生命的表征。活化物体形式多样，并且用途各异。下面罗列了一些典型的活化物体作为范例。这类生物中有很大一部分都被作为守卫，对那些毫无戒心的冒险者发起突然袭击。剩下的则是作为土豪们的玩物，被用于处理一些零活，诸如此类。

Construct Armor (Hardness 3).name: 构装护甲-硬度3 Construct Armor (Hardness 3)
Construct Armor (Hardness 3).description: 与普通的物体一样，活化皮甲同样拥有硬度。硬度可以减少其所受到的任何伤害，其数值等同于硬度的数值。一旦活化皮甲的生命值降低至一半以下，或是受到重击伤害后，其构装护甲将会破损，其AC降低至11。

Bugbear Creeper.name: 熊地精潜伏者 Bugbear Creeper
Bugbear Creeper.publicNotes:
最常见的熊地精暴徒很擅长潜伏在阴影中的技艺。

这些鬼祟且残忍的地精亚种生物以散布恐惧和折磨受害者为乐。熊地精是潜伏在壁橱里和床底下的怪物。他们在偏远的农场进行猎食，会在深夜通过敲打或制造木板的吱吖声来揭示自身的存在，并以此构筑有人潜伏于此的骇人气氛和让人心生疑窦的恐惧感。

Creep.name: 潜伏 Creep
Creep.description:
触发 15尺内的生物获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened}状态，或者惊惧值增加

效果 熊地精潜伏者躲藏、潜行或快步。

Bugbear Night Terror.name: 熊地精夜之恐怖者 Bugbear Night Terror
Bugbear Night Terror.publicNotes:
最常见的熊地精暴徒很擅长潜伏在阴影中的技艺。

这些鬼祟且残忍的地精亚种生物以散布恐惧和折磨受害者为乐。熊地精是潜伏在壁橱里和床底下的怪物。他们在偏远的农场进行猎食，会在深夜通过敲打或制造木板的吱吖声来揭示自身的存在，并以此构筑有人潜伏于此的骇人气氛和让人心生疑窦的恐惧感。

Startling Grasp.name: 惊人抓握 Startling Grasp
Startling Grasp.description: 熊地精行走10尺，之后尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.i95kcGLIQKOTsnv6]{擒拿: 运动}一个视熊地精为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪 Undetected}的生物。若成功，该生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，若熊地精在擒抱的运动检定上大成功，则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Wicked Mauler.name: 狞怖拳手 Wicked Mauler
Wicked Mauler.description: 熊地精对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened}生物的伤害检定获得+4环境加值。

Bugbear Terror.name: 熊地精恐怖者 Bugbear Terror
Bugbear Terror.publicNotes:
最常见的熊地精暴徒很擅长潜伏在阴影中的技艺。

这些鬼祟且残忍的地精亚种生物以散布恐惧和折磨受害者为乐。熊地精是潜伏在壁橱里和床底下的怪物。他们在偏远的农场进行猎食，会在深夜通过敲打或制造木板的吱吖声来揭示自身的存在，并以此构筑有人潜伏于此的骇人气氛和让人心生疑窦的恐惧感。

Startling Grasp.name: 惊人抓握 Startling Grasp
Startling Grasp.description: 熊地精行走10尺，之后尝试@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.i95kcGLIQKOTsnv6]{擒拿: 运动}一个视熊地精为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{无踪 Undetected}的生物。若成功，该生物陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}，若熊地精在擒抱的运动检定上大成功，则@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}。

Wicked Mauler.name: 狞怖拳手 Wicked Mauler
Wicked Mauler.description: 熊地精对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened}生物的伤害检定获得+2环境加值。

Charlatan (PFS 4-05).name: 骗子 Charlatan (PFS 4-05)
Charlatan (PFS 4-05).publicNotes:
骗子利用伪装和误导从毫无戒心和糊涂的人手里诈骗金钱或其他贵重物品。通过天花乱坠的吹嘘转移受害者的注意力来扒窃他们的口袋，或者伪造灵媒等都是典型的诈骗手段。

一些罪犯是走投无路的人，他们别无选择只能通过行违法之事来生存，而另一些人选择犯罪来寻求愉悦，组成帮派或地下组织，专门从事非法活动。

Versatile Performance.name: 多才表演者 Versatile Performance
Versatile Performance.description: 骗子可以用表演取代交涉来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{建立印象 Make an Impression}，用表演取代威吓来@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{挫败士气 Demoralize}，他们也可以用表演检定进行欺骗检定或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{乔装 Impersonate}。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
骗子对陷入措手不及的敌人额外造成1d6精准伤害。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Dero Stalker (PFS 4-05).name: 癫儒潜行者 Dero Stalker (PFS 4-05)
Dero Stalker (PFS 4-05).publicNotes:
癫儒潜行者负责在夜间探索地表世界并寻找潜在的绑架目标。

癫儒是矮小精瘦的类人生物，他们生有乳白色的眼瞳，灰白色的皮肤和杂乱的米白或灰色的头发。这些神秘精类的后裔被遗弃在格拉利昂（Golarion）最深邃黑暗的洞穴中，对于世上绝大多数的地表种族来说，癫儒是恐怖故事和民间传说的主题。他们潜伏在大都会地区的下方，强行对被俘生物执行残忍且扭曲的实验。癫儒通常有3尺高，重约70磅。

Nimble Dodge.name: 灵巧闪避 Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
需求 癫儒潜行者没有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.D5mg6Tc7Jzrj6ro7]{超载 Encumbered}。

触发 有生物以癫儒为目标作出一次攻击，且癫儒能够看到攻击者

效果 癫儒试着躲开攻击，这使得它在对抗触发攻击时，AC获得+2环境加值。

Vulnerable to Sunlight.name: 阳光易伤 Vulnerable to Sunlight
Vulnerable to Sunlight.description: 癫儒潜行者若暴露于阳光下，每小时会受到[[/r 4]]{4伤害}。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
癫儒潜行者对措手不及的生物造成额外1d6点精准伤害。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Drag.name: 拖拽 Drag
Drag.description: 硕鼠对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{倒地 Prone}敌人发动啃咬打击。若命中，除了造成伤害外，硕鼠还能够行走至多10尺，并拖拽该敌人一起移动。

Filth Fever.name: 腐热症 Filth Fever
Filth Fever.description:
腐热症造成的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}状态不会自行改善，一直持续直到疾病被治愈。

豁免检定 @Check[fortitude|dc:14]

阶段1 无感染症状 ([[/gmr 1d4 #hours]]{1d4小时})

阶段2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}（1天）

阶段3 恶心1和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}（1天）

阶段4 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{失去意识 Unconscious}（1天）

阶段5 死亡

Gnaw Bones.name: 嚼骨 Gnaw Bones
Gnaw Bones.description: 被硕鼠重击的生物必须进行@Check[fortitude|dc:20]豁免，失败时骨头或软骨被硕鼠咬断，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{受伤 Wounded 1}。

Fetid Familiar.name: 恶臭魔宠 Fetid Familiar
Fetid Familiar.publicNotes:
臭鼬有着独特的黑色身体和白色条纹或斑点，大部分生物一眼就能认出它来。那些闻到臭鼬体味的人很少会再去招惹臭鼬，因为令人作呕的恶臭会持续几小时甚至几天。要除去这种气味很困难，通常需要借助炼金术或魔法。

这些杂食动物在黄昏最活跃，以浆果、幼虫和昆虫为食。一些农民甚至欢迎这些动物他们的农场附近生活，这样破坏农田的害虫就会变少。

Evil Musk.name: 邪恶麝香 Evil Musk
Evil Musk.description:
恶臭魔宠在@Template[line|distance:10]范围内喷出一股刺鼻的麝香。范围内的每个生物必须尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:15]豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}。

大失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 2}，并且陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}，直到麝香被移除或中和，这需要10分钟的肥皂擦洗。

Giant Fetid Familiar.name: 巨化恶臭魔宠 Giant Fetid Familiar
Giant Fetid Familiar.publicNotes:
臭鼬有着独特的黑色身体和白色条纹或斑点，大部分生物一眼就能认出它来。那些闻到臭鼬体味的人很少会再去招惹臭鼬，因为令人作呕的恶臭会持续几小时甚至几天。要除去这种气味很困难，通常需要借助炼金术或魔法。

这些杂食动物在黄昏最活跃，以浆果、幼虫和昆虫为食。一些农民甚至欢迎这些动物他们的农场附近生活，这样破坏农田的害虫就会变少。

Evil Blinding Musk.name: 邪恶致盲麝香 Evil Blinding Musk
Evil Blinding Musk.description:
恶臭魔宠在@Template[cone|distance:15]范围内喷出一股刺鼻的麝香。范围内的每个生物必须尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:16]豁免。

大成功 目标不受影响。

成功 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 1}。

失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3}。

大失败 目标@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{目盲 Blinded}1轮，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{恶心 Sickened 3}，并且直到麝香被移除或中和前陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{毁灭 Doomed 1}，这需要10分钟的肥皂擦洗。

Grim Rictus Bridge Guard.name: 歪嘴帮守桥者 Grim Rictus Bridge Guard
Grim Rictus Bridge Guard.publicNotes:
守卫是城镇守卫或城市卫队的普通成员，为了制止争端、打击罪犯、服从命令而受训。他们大多数只能对付菜鸟冒险者或小贼，但是只要时间拖得够久，源源不断赶来的援兵足以消灭大多数威胁。

更庞大的社会依赖于那些具有权威并能解释和贯彻法律的人。在秩序良好的社会中，这些执法者会更公平地履行他们的职责。在中立和邪恶的国家里，这些人可能更加严厉而残忍（根据阵营具体表现不同），对那些无法支付罚金的人施加严厉的惩罚措施。

Grim Rictus Robber.name: 歪嘴帮强盗 Grim Rictus Robber
Grim Rictus Robber.publicNotes:
虽然不是每个平民都受到压迫，但它们中的很多人都过着艰苦的生活，只为了家人的吃住条件能相对舒适。虽然很多平民都是沉默的普通人，但是有时他们会奋起反抗，要么站起来面对压迫者，要么说服甚至被骗加入邪恶的计划和犯罪阴谋。平民团结起来就能拥有力量，一群平民能做到的事情有时远超他们统治者的想像。

不幸的是，每个社会都有生活在底层的人。虽然好的社区会为底层人民提供帮助，但是有时——由于经济衰退、饥荒或战争——社会无力负担这些不幸的人。在无情的中立或邪恶的社会中，贫穷是一种不可避免的现象，永远无法真正根除，而更糟糕的情况是，贫穷被当做一种被操纵用来获取整治利益的工具。

Power of the Mob.name: 暴民的力量 Power of the Mob
Power of the Mob.description: 当三个或更多强盗相邻时，每个强盗在进行@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{推撞 Shove}所需的运动检定、攻击检定和伤害检定上都获得+1环境加值。

Overtaxed Vrisk.name: 过度加班的弗里斯克 Overworked Vrisk

Unfinished.name: 半成品 Unfinished
Unfinished.description: 弗里斯克光滑的脑袋上没有耳朵,他永久@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{耳聋 Deaf}。他在任何需要听觉的察觉检定上自动大失败并且免疫听觉特征的效果。他可以在施法时提供语言成分,在启动魔法物品时提供命令词,但当他执行一个听觉特征的动作时,他必须成功通过@Check[flat|dc:5]检定,否则动作失败。同时他拥有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.aAoFc10cOpxGypOY]{手语 Sign Language}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.yUuU9xyotrpwpTyC]{读唇 Read Lips}技能专长。

Golem Antimagic.name: 魔像抗魔 Golem Antimagic
Golem Antimagic.description:
被伤害：虚能 ([[/r 2d8]]{2d8伤害}，范围伤害或持续伤害则为[[/r 1d8]]{1d8伤害}；被治疗：命能 (范围效果则为@Damage[1d6[healing]]{1d6生命值})；被减速：情绪

魔像免疫法术和魔法能力，魔像自身所拥有的除外。但是每种魔像都会被少数几个特定法术以特殊方式影响。这些效果在魔像的具体数据里会以缩写的方式给出，这里则是详细解释。如果列出的条目包含多种类型（例如“寒冷和水”）则这些类型的法术都能对魔像产生影响。

  • 被伤害 任意该种类的魔法以该魔像为目标时，都能对该魔像造成所列伤害（该伤害无伤害类型），并取代原本的法术效果。如果魔像开始回合时位于该种类型的范围魔法效果中，或受到该种魔法的持续性效果影响，则受到括号内所标明的伤害值。
  • 被治疗 任意该种类的魔法以该魔像为目标时，都能解除该魔像的缓慢效果并治疗魔像相当于法术伤害一半的HP。如果魔像开始回合时位于该种类型的范围魔法效果中，则获得括号内所列的生命值。
  • 被减速 任意该种类的魔法以该魔像为目标时，都能让魔像陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}，持续[[/br 2d6 #rounds]]{2d6轮}，并取代原本的法术效果。如果魔像开始回合时位于该种类型的范围魔法效果中，则魔像在该轮中陷入缓慢1。
  • 法术弱点 每种魔像都会有针对某一种或几种特定的法术的弱点，具体效果会描述在数据中。

Vulnerable to Daze.name: 法术弱点-晕眩术 Vulnerable to Daze
Vulnerable to Daze.description: 弗里斯克会受到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{晕眩术 Daze}影响就如同他是一个活物一样。

Vulnerable to Redact.name: 法术弱点-篡辑术 Vulnerable to Redact
Vulnerable to Redact.description: 如果弗里斯克成为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ifXNOhtmU4fKL68v]{篡辑术 Redact}的目标或者被任何其他擦除文字的法术命中，他必须通过@Check[will|dc:18]豁免否则就会因为额头的符文被擦除而被立即摧毁。

Seldrick Dralston (1-2).name: 塞德里克·德拉斯顿 Seldrick Dralston (1-2)
Seldrick Dralston (1-2).publicNotes:
当一名神祇或神祇的先驱花费一小点力量来唤回一个祭司时，一位不灭侍僧就会诞生。有些祭司生前的力量则强到能够以自己的意志归来，尽管它们的实力会被大大削弱。

不灭侍僧在不死生物中是个异类。他们既不是自愿被转化为亡灵，严格意义上说，也不是违背意愿被转化。不灭侍僧的诞生是一名神祇的直接干预行为，这既是赐福也是诅咒，通常被赠与那些因无法控制的情况而未能完成神圣使命的忠实牧师。

Denounce Heretic.name: 呵斥异端 Denounce Heretic
Denounce Heretic.description:
触发 距离塞德里克60尺内、它肉眼可见的一个不信仰默语魔道的生物施展神术；

效果 塞德里克尝试反制触发法术，使用它的法术攻击加值，反制等级为1。如果塞德里克未能反制该法术，则施法者在24小时内临时免疫此能力。

Field of Undeath.name: 亡灵之地 Field of Undeath
Field of Undeath.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:20]{20尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

灵光范围内拥有虚能治疗的友方获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{快速治疗 Fast Healing 2}。灵光内的生物在接受命能治疗前，必须成功通过@Check[flat|dc:5]检定，否则不会从那个效果中获得治疗。

Seldrick Dralston (3-4).name: 塞德里克·德拉斯顿 Seldrick Dralston (3-4)
Seldrick Dralston (3-4).publicNotes:
当一名神祇或神祇的先驱花费一小点力量来唤回一个祭司时，一位不灭侍僧就会诞生。有些祭司生前的力量则强到能够以自己的意志归来，尽管它们的实力会被大大削弱。

Denounce Heretic.description:
触发 距离塞德里克60尺内、它肉眼可见的一个不信仰默语魔道的生物施展神术；

效果 塞德里克尝试反制触发法术，使用它的法术攻击加值，反制等级为1。如果塞德里克未能反制该法术，则施法者在24小时内临时免疫此能力。

Field of Undeath.name: 亡灵之地 Field of Undeath
Field of Undeath.description:
@Template[emanation|distance:20]{20尺} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.v61oEQaDdcRpaZ9X]{灵光}

灵光范围内拥有虚能治疗的友方获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.fJSNOw4zHGbIm4bZ]{快速治疗 Fast Healing 3}。灵光内的生物在接受命能治疗前，必须成功通过@Check[flat|dc:5]检定，否则不会从那个效果中获得治疗。

Shard of Aslynn (1-2).name: 阿斯琳的碎片 Shard of Aslynn (1-2)

Aslynn's Gaze.name: 阿斯琳的凝视 Aslynn's Gaze
Aslynn's Gaze.description:
阿斯琳凝视一个生物，使其遭受强烈的痛苦和迫在眉睫的末日感的折磨。该生物必须尝试@Check[will|dc:17]豁免。由于此效果不是视觉效果，生物不需要看到阿斯琳就能被影响。

大成功 目标不受影响，并且在1天内临时免疫阿斯琳的凝视。

成功 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

失败 目标陷入惊惧1，并陷入1轮@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

大失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}，并陷入1分钟缓慢1。

Nightmarish Wounds.name: 噩梦伤口 Nightmarish Wounds
Nightmarish Wounds.description: 阿斯琳的爪抓造成的伤口会导致生物沉浸在其最糟糕的噩梦中。受到阿斯琳爪抓伤害的生物必须进行@Check[fortitude|dc:17]豁免，失败将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1天。大失败时，或被再次击中且豁免第二次失败时，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1天。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Shard of Aslynn (1-2).allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Shard of Aslynn (3-4).name: 阿斯琳的碎片 Shard of Aslynn (3-4)

Aslynn's Gaze.name: 阿斯琳的凝视 Aslynn's Gaze
Aslynn's Gaze.description:
阿斯琳凝视一个生物，使其遭受强烈的痛苦和迫在眉睫的末日感的折磨。该生物必须尝试@Check[will|dc:20]豁免。由于此效果不是视觉效果，生物不需要看到阿斯琳就能被影响。

成功 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 1}。

失败 目标陷入惊惧1，并陷入1轮@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{缓慢 Slowed 1}。

大失败 目标陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{惊惧 Frightened 2}，并陷入1分钟缓慢1。

Nightmarish Wounds.name: 噩梦伤口 Nightmarish Wounds
Nightmarish Wounds.description: 阿斯琳的爪抓造成的伤口会导致生物沉浸在其最糟糕的噩梦中。受到阿斯琳爪抓伤害的生物必须进行@Check[fortitude|dc:20]豁免，失败将陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1天。大失败时，或被再次击中且豁免第二次失败时，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1天。

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Shard of Aslynn (3-4).allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Skeletal Pathfinder.name: 骷髅开拓者 Skeletal Pathfinder
Skeletal Pathfinder.publicNotes:
这些士兵在死后继续服从命令，仍旧挥舞着它们花了一生时间学习使用的军备。虽然它们常由人类与矮人的骨骼制成，以其他类人生物为原料的骷髅士兵也很常见，例如熊地精、大地精还有兽。通常，这些士兵会拿着它们生前种族中最常见的武器，而非下面数据中列出的。

在亡者的行列中，没有哪种不死有着如骷髅一般无穷的数量与种类。虽然大多数骷髅几乎完全由骨头构成，但少部分还保留着一些肉屑来帮助它们运动，比如翼膜。

Set Defense.name: 设防 Set Defense
Set Defense.description: 骷髅士兵架好它的大砍刀（或其他触及武器）来保卫它周围的区域。它获得仅限该武器使用的@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{反应打击 Reactive Strike}反应动作。这将持续到骷髅士兵使用带有移动或攻击特征的动作或它被摧毁。

Skeletal Pathfinder Veteran.name: 骷髅资深开拓者 Skeletal Pathfinder Veteran
Skeletal Pathfinder Veteran.publicNotes:
这些骷髅继承了它们生前的狡诈。

骷髅是最为常见的一类不死生物，它们是由污秽的死灵力量所维持着形态的骨架，出没于那些古老的地城和被遗忘的墓园之中。

Skulk Raider.name: 潜伏客袭击者 Skulk Raider
Skulk Raider.publicNotes:
胆小懒惰的潜伏客生活在有组织社会的边缘，他们毫无顾虑地盗窃他人的财物。甚至谋杀对他们来说也不过是另一种必需品，他们认为潜入一所房子、杀死屋内的居民并取走他们想要的东西并不是什么大不了的事情。

潜伏客那宛如变色龙一般的能力可以融入到周遭的环境中，这使得他们很难被发现，因此他们一直存在于大型聚居地周边且几乎不可能被永久驱逐。他们通常以不超过16人的小组进行活动，因为超过此人数的群体经常会爆发针对彼此的暴力行为。尽管潜伏客们认为彼此都有着被驱逐和被憎恨的类似经历，但这并不能形成足够强大的纽带，无法将这一大群生物长期团结在一起来实现共同目标。

城市的出入口，尤其是那些下水道之类缺乏守卫驻守的通道，是潜伏客最喜欢涉足的场所。这些地点让他们能够近距离观察进出城市的人群，同时也为他们提供了在当局发现他们的存在时，可以用来快速逃离的选项。在极少数的情况下，一名训练有素的潜伏客能够在当地的盗贼行会中出人头地，并成为困难工作的不二人选。然而，他们那令人厌恶的个性和极端自私的本性，通常意味着他们无法获得长期的领袖职位。

标准的潜伏客有6英尺高，身体结构和瘦高的人类相似。潜伏客发育很快，能够活到50岁，不过他们通常会在到达寿命之前早早便遭遇到暴力对待。有极少数潜伏客能够设法从他们那充满暴力且畏缩在怨恨之间的社会中逃离，并可以表现为任意阵营，但那些仍旧被自身传统所束缚的潜伏客总是把这些自我放逐之人视为最坏的叛徒，而这种逃难者往往会成为能够把所有其他受害者排除在外的消灭目标。有不止一支潜伏客团体由于为了追踪这种流放者而组织一场计划不周但充满暴力激情的尝试，并最终在这不顾一切的尝试里向当局暴露了自身的存在，使得这场意料之外的计划变更最终招致了自身的毁灭。

Camouflaged Step.name: 伪装步伐 Camouflaged Step
Camouflaged Step.description: 潜伏客无需半速移动便可以在森林之中和地下设施里获得@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{掩盖行踪 Cover Tracks}动作的好处。

Chameleon Skin.name: 变色皮肤 Chameleon Skin
Chameleon Skin.description: 潜伏客的皮肤变得符合周围环境。只要他们的体表的大部分皮肤没有被服装或护甲所复盖，潜伏客就可以在用于@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{躲藏 Hide}的隐秘检定中获得+2环境加值。

Sneak Attack.name: 偷袭 Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description:
潜伏客的打击对措手不及的生物造成额外1d6点精准伤害。

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.SneakAttack]

Unfinished.name: 半成品 Unfinished
Unfinished.description: 弗里斯克光滑的脑袋上没有耳朵,他永久@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{耳聋 Deaf}。他在任何需要听觉的察觉检定上自动大失败并且免疫听觉特征的效果。他可以在施法时提供语言成分,在启动魔法物品时提供命令词,但当他执行一个听觉特征的动作时,他必须成功通过@Check[flat|dc:5]检定,否则动作失败。同时他拥有@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.aAoFc10cOpxGypOY]{手语 Sign Language}和@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.yUuU9xyotrpwpTyC]{读唇 Read Lips}技能专长。

  • 法术弱点 每种魔像都会有针对某一种或几种特定的法术的弱点，具体效果会描述在数据中。

Vulnerable to Daze.name: 法术弱点-晕眩术 Vulnerable to Daze
Vulnerable to Daze.description: 弗里斯克会受到@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4gBIw4IDrSfFHik4]{晕眩术 Daze}影响就如同他是一个活物一样。

Vulnerable to Redact.name: 法术弱点-篡辑术 Vulnerable to Redact
Vulnerable to Redact.description: 如果弗里斯克成为@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ifXNOhtmU4fKL68v]{篡辑术 Redact}的目标或者被任何其他擦除文字的法术命中，他必须通过@Check[will|dc:20]豁免否则就会因为额头的符文被擦除而被立即摧毁。

Barbed Quills.name: 带刺羽尖 Barbed Quills
Barbed Quills.description:
频率 每天一次

触发 利亚斯可拉被无武装打击或非长触及近战武器打击命中

效果 利亚斯可拉将骨羽断在攻击者的皮肉中。对触发生物造成@Damage[1d8[piercing]]伤害(@Check[reflex|dc:17|basic|traits:damaging-effect])。大失败的生物还会在骨羽钩进身体时受到@Damage[1d4[bleed]]伤害。

Trick Attack.name: 诡计攻击 Trick Attack
Trick Attack.description: 利亚斯可拉利用阴险诡诈尝试一次巧妙的攻击，让敌人猝不及防。利亚斯可拉选择她的一件武器。用该武器发动的下一次攻击额外造成1d6精准伤害。此外，利亚斯可拉可以用交互动作拔出该武器（若选择的是手弩，则可以装填之）。

Barbed Quills.name: 带刺羽尖 Barbed Quills
Barbed Quills.description:
频率 每天一次

触发 利亚斯可拉被无武装打击或非长触及近战武器打击命中

效果 利亚斯可拉将骨羽断在攻击者的皮肉中。对触发生物造成@Damage[2d8[piercing]]伤害(@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|traits:damaging-effect])。大失败的生物还会在骨羽钩进身体时受到@Damage[(1d4+1)[bleed]]伤害。

Trick Attack.name: 诡计攻击 Trick Attack
Trick Attack.description: 利亚斯可拉利用阴险诡诈尝试一次巧妙的攻击，让敌人猝不及防。利亚斯可拉选择她的一件武器。用该武器发动的下一次攻击额外造成2d6精准伤害。此外，利亚斯可拉可以用交互动作拔出该武器（若选择的是手弩，则可以装填之）。

Fascinating Lecture (1-2).name: 迷魂演讲 Fascinating Lecture (1-2)
Fascinating Lecture (1-2).disable: @Check[intimidation|dc:17]来打断演讲，@Check[thievery|dc:20] (受训) 刮掉讲台上的一个符文，或用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic} (2环级; 反制DC18)反制其中一个符文；解除此陷阱需要累计三次成功。
Fascinating Lecture (1-2).hazarddescription: 讲台上一个小个子迦伦德女人的半透明图像突然开始讲授惑控魔法的本质。
Fascinating Lecture (1-2).routine:
(1动作) （奥法，胁迫，惑控，心灵，非致命） 图像行云流水地讲授极为高深的课题，在迫使听众保持注意力的同时，也压倒了他们的思想。房间里的每个生物必须通过@Check[will|dc:20|traits:arcane,compulsion,enchantment,mental,nonlethal]豁免，受到@Damage[1d6[mental]]{1d6非致命心灵伤害}，以及以下效果。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物摆脱了大部分心灵负担，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}，受到一半伤害。

失败 生物被迫只能努力处理所有的信息，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}，受到完整伤害。

大失败 生物精神完全集中于演讲，陷入1轮震慑，1分钟@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}，并受到双倍伤害。此危害造成的伤害不会终止迷魂状态。生命值被迷魂演讲降到0点的生物将昏迷不醒，直到恢复生命值。因此昏迷的生物1小时后将自动恢复1点生命值并醒来。

Take Your Seats.name: 请就座 Take Your Seats
Take Your Seats.description:
触发 生物尝试接触讲台上的研究文页。

效果 文页被一个强大的惑控魔法结界保护起来，直到本险情被彻底解除。没有生物会产生去触碰文页的意愿。房间里的所有生物必须尝试@Check[will|dc:20]豁免。然后陷阱骰先攻。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物必须花一个动作靠近教室里的一张空桌子。

失败 生物必须花两个动作靠近教室里的一张空桌子并坐下，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1小时。

大失败 生物花费下个回合，用于靠近教室里的一张空桌子并坐下。陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1小时，并陷入一分钟@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}状态。

Fascinating Lecture (3-4).name: 迷魂演讲 Fascinating Lecture (3-4)
Fascinating Lecture (3-4).disable: @Check[intimidation|dc:20]来打断演讲，@Check[thievery|dc:23] (受训) 刮掉讲台上的一个符文，或用@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic} (3环级; 反制DC20)反制其中一个符文；解除此陷阱需要累计三次成功。
Fascinating Lecture (3-4).hazarddescription: 讲台上一个小个子迦伦德女人的半透明图像突然开始讲授惑控魔法的本质。
Fascinating Lecture (3-4).routine:
(1动作) （奥法，胁迫，惑控，心灵，非致命） 图像行云流水地讲授极为高深的课题，在迫使听众保持注意力的同时，也压倒了他们的思想。房间里的每个生物必须通过@Check[will|dc:22|traits:arcane,compulsion,enchantment,mental,nonlethal]豁免，受到@Damage[2d6[mental]]{2d6非致命心灵伤害}，以及以下效果。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物摆脱了大部分心灵负担，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 1}，受到一半伤害。

失败 生物被迫只能努力处理所有的信息，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{震慑 Stunned 2}，受到完整伤害。

大失败 生物精神完全集中于演讲，陷入1轮震慑，1分钟@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}，并受到双倍伤害。此危害造成的伤害不会终止迷魂状态。生命值被迷魂演讲降到0点的生物将昏迷不醒，直到恢复生命值。因此昏迷的生物1小时后将自动恢复1点生命值并醒来。

Take Your Seats.description:
触发 生物尝试接触讲台上的研究文页。

效果 文页被一个强大的惑控魔法结界保护起来，直到本险情被彻底解除。没有生物会产生去触碰文页的意愿。房间里的所有生物必须尝试@Check[will|dc:22]豁免。然后陷阱骰先攻。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物必须花一个动作靠近教室里的一张空桌子。

失败 生物必须花两个动作靠近教室里的一张空桌子并坐下，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1}，持续1小时。

大失败 生物花费下个回合，用于靠近教室里的一张空桌子并坐下。陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 2}，持续1小时，并陷入一分钟@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{迷魂 Fascinated}状态。

Unbridled Necromantic Energy (1-2).name: 失控死灵能量 Unbridled Necromantic Energy (1-2)
Unbridled Necromantic Energy (1-2).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:17] (受训)修复一些奥术结界，@Check[religion|dc:20]或@Check[occultism|dc:20] (受训)平息房间里的死灵能量。
Unbridled Necromantic Energy (1-2).hazarddescription: 房间里包含的魔法能量在黑暗的闪电中涌动。

Necromantic Discharge.name: 死灵释放 Necromantic Discharge
Necromantic Discharge.description:
触发 生物进入房间。

效果 房间里涌动的死灵能量像闪电一样散发出去，淹没房间里或房间外三格走廊上的所有生物。这些区域内的每个生物必须因被黑暗能量笼罩而尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:18|traits:damaging-effect]豁免，它造成@Damage[2d8[void]]伤害，或对有虚能治疗的生物造成@Damage[2d8[vitality]]伤害。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到一半伤害，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}，持续1小时。

失败 生物受到完整伤害，陷入力竭1，持续1小时。

大失败 生物受到双倍伤害，陷入力竭1，持续1天。

Unbridled Necromantic Energy (3-4).name: 失控死灵能量 Unbridled Necromantic Energy (3-4)
Unbridled Necromantic Energy (3-4).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:20] (受训)修复一些奥术结界，@Check[religion|dc:23]或@Check[occultism|dc:23] (受训)平息房间里的死灵能量。
Unbridled Necromantic Energy (3-4).hazarddescription: 房间里包含的魔法能量在黑暗的闪电中涌动。

Necromantic Discharge.name: 死灵释放 Necromantic Discharge
Necromantic Discharge.description:
触发 生物进入房间。

效果 房间里涌动的死灵能量像闪电一样散发出去，淹没房间里或房间外三格走廊上的所有生物。这些区域内的每个生物必须因被黑暗能量笼罩而尝试@Check[fortitude|dc:21|traits:damaging-effect]豁免，它造成@Damage[(2d8+5)[void]]伤害，或对有虚能治疗的生物造成@Damage[(2d8+5)[vitality]]伤害。

大成功 生物不受影响。

成功 生物受到一半伤害，陷入@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{力竭 Enfeebled 1}，持续1小时。

失败 生物受到完整伤害，陷入力竭1，持续1小时。

大失败 生物受到双倍伤害，陷入力竭1，持续1天。

Witch of the Owl.name: 猫头鹰女巫 Witch of the Owl

Bloodletting.name: 放血 Bloodletting
Bloodletting.description: 女巫的眼线对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}目标造成穿刺或挥砍伤害时，还会造成1点持续性流血伤害。

Witch's Gaze.name: 女巫的监视者 Witch's Gaze

Bloodletting.name: 放血 Bloodletting
Bloodletting.description: 女巫的监视者对@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{措手不及 Off-Guard}目标造成穿刺或挥砍伤害时，还会造成1d4点持续性流血伤害。

Lay Down Your Lives.name: 保命 Lay Down Your Lives
Lay Down Your Lives.description:
触发 30尺内女巫之爪的盟友受到生命值伤害

效果 该盟友受到一半生命值伤害，女巫之爪承受剩余的伤害。

You're Next.name: 下个到你 You're Next
You're Next.description:
触发 女巫之翼将一个生物的生命值降到0点

效果 女巫之翼对一个彼此可以互相看见的生物尝试威吓检定以@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{挫败士气 Demoralize}，并具有+2环境加值。/p>

Butterfly's Breath Trap (1-2).name: 蝶息陷阱 Butterfly's Breath Trap (1-2)
Butterfly's Breath Trap (1-2).disable: @Check[survival|dc:17]以闭气避免闻到香水，@Check[occultism|dc:16] (受训)以凭空画出守护符文来驱散毒素，或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic} (1环级；反制DC15)以反制毒素。
Butterfly's Breath Trap (1-2).hazarddescription: 甜腻的香气在议会大楼外的空气中飘荡，袭击所有吸入者的感官。

Goodnight Kiss.name: 晚安吻 Goodnight Kiss
Goodnight Kiss.description:
触发 生物打开色嘉达议会大楼的门

效果 10尺内所有生物暴露于蝶息毒素。

Butterfly's Breath.name: 蝶息 Butterfly's Breath
Butterfly's Breath.description:
豁免检定/strong> @Check[fortitude|dc:18]

潜伏期 10分钟

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} (6小时)

阶段2 呆滞1 (12小时)

阶段3 呆滞1 (24小时)

Butterfly's Breath Trap (3-4).name: 蝶息陷阱 Butterfly's Breath Trap (3-4)
Butterfly's Breath Trap (3-4).disable: @Check[survival|dc:20]以闭气避免闻到香水，@Check[occultism|dc:19] (受训)以凭空画出守护符文来驱散毒素，或@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{解除魔法 Dispel Magic} (2级；反制DC17)以反制毒素。
Butterfly's Breath Trap (3-4).hazarddescription: 甜腻的香气在议会大楼外的空气中飘荡，袭击所有吸入者的感官。

Goodnight Kiss.description:
触发 生物打开色嘉达议会大楼的门

效果 10尺内所有生物暴露于蝶息毒素。

Butterfly's Breath.name: 蝶息 Butterfly's Breath
Butterfly's Breath.description:
豁免检定/strong> @Check[fortitude|dc:21]

潜伏期 10分钟

阶段1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{呆滞 Stupefied 1} (6小时)

阶段2 呆滞1 (12小时)

阶段3 呆滞1 (24小时)

Darkened Shadow Bombard.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:28] or @Check[thievery|dc:28] to disrupt the cannon; two checks are required to disable it
Darkened Shadow Bombard.hazarddescription: A cannon built of cast iron and infused with shadow magic, mounted on the side of Aslynn's flying ship.
Darkened Shadow Bombard.routine: (three actions) The cannon fires a blast that contains as many PCs as possible, choosing randomly in the event of a tie, then reloads.

Load the Cannons.name: Load the Cannons
Load the Cannons.description:
Trigger The ship flies within 30 feet of a PC

Effect The cannon reloads and rolls initiative.

Darkened Shadow Bombard.name: Darkened Shadow Bombard

Storm-Wrought Chains.name: Storm-Wrought Chains
Storm-Wrought Chains.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25] (expert) to release the lock, or @Check[arcana|dc:25] or @Check[nature|dc:25] (expert) to harmlessly release the storm's energy
Storm-Wrought Chains.hazarddescription: Brightly polished copper chains rumble with distant thunder and statically charge the air.

Storm's Rage.name: Storm's Rage
Storm's Rage.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to break or escape the chains

Effect The chains release a devastating blast of lightning that deals @Damage[(4d8+14)[electricity]] damage to all creatures in the room. Affected creatures must each attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for 1 minute.

Failure The creature takes full damage and becomes deafened for 1 hour.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage. It also becomes deafened for 8 hours.

Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger Dura critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with her Aldori dueling sword.

Effect Dura attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of her Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Dura take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand her language.
Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess

Nathatel (7-8).name: Nathatel (7-8)
Nathatel (7-8).privateNotes: Force damage from melee strikes and Cascade Countermeasure focus spell removed as Nathatel does not have Arcane Cascade per Alex from the Org Play Server. Focus Point value not changed from 3.

Redirect Magic.name: Redirect Magic
Redirect Magic.description:
Trigger Nathatel succeeds at a save against a foe's harmful spell, or a foe fails a spell attack roll against him

Effect Nathatel redirects the spell's energy back at its caster. The caster takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage per spell rank (@Check[reflex|dc:23] negates). If the harmful spell dealt damage of a particular type, such fire damage, use that type instead of bludgeoning.

Spellstrike.name: Spellstrike
Spellstrike.description: Nathatel channels a spell into a melee attack to deliver a magically charged attack. He Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into his attack instead. He makes a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack, which gains the arcane trait. His spell is coupled with the attack, using his attack roll to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty isn't applied until after he has completed the Spellstrike. After he uses Spellstrike, Nathatel can't do so again until he recharges this ability as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. He also recharges his Spellstrike when he casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9mPEoOPN0AMuixIv]{Force Fang} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r82rqcm0MmGaBFkM]{Thunderous Strike}.

Alarmingly Efficient Unseen Arson Assist.name: Alarmingly Efficient Unseen Arson Assistant
Alarmingly Efficient Unseen Arson Assist.disable: A successful @Check[athletics|dc:18], @Check[nature|dc:18], or @Check[survival|dc:18] check from an adjacent square is sufficient to smother one 5-foot- square of fire; each attempt is an Interact action. Dousing the flames automatically extinguishes one or more sections of fire, with no check. Water typically clears a 5-foot square if the amount is small (such as that from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WzLKjSw6hsBhuklC]{Create Water} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jfVCuOpzC6mUrf6f]{Hydraulic Push}). Larger amounts of water, such as a full bucket, typically douse a 10-foot-by-10-foot area (or 4 squares in some other shape). Throwing a bucket of water on flames requires an Interact action. A waterskin doesn't contain enough water to put out even 1 square of fire. Cold can also put out fire, but only if the cold can affect an area; cold is usually less effective than water, so a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.EpxmUtLpCkE8R6KJ]{Frost Vial} typically puts out only 1 square of fire, and ray of frost is ineffective.
Alarmingly Efficient Unseen Arson Assist.hazarddescription: Fire engulfs four 5-foot-by-5-foot sections of the library, then spreads erratically on each of its turns as burning books are carried about by the modified unseen servant.
Alarmingly Efficient Unseen Arson Assist.routine: On its turn, the fire spreads into a number of additional squares equal to half the number of squares the fire currently occupies plus the number of books that the lurkers in light lit on fire this round, minimum 1 square. You determine the squares the fire spreads into, but any spread from lit books must affect a bookshelf; fires spread in this way do not need to spread into adjacent squares. Any creature that ends its turn next to the flames takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, and any creature within the flames takes @Damage[4d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic] save for both). A creature can take damage from flames only once per round.

-2 to All Saves (If Heartstone is Lost).name: -2 to All Saves (If Heartstone is Lost)

Aslynn's Gaze.name: Aslynn's Gaze
Aslynn's Gaze.description:
Aslynn gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom; the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:30] save. Since this effect isn't visual, the creature doesn't need to be able to see Aslynn to be affected.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Aslynn's gaze for 1 day.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Aslynn can takes on the specific appearance of any Medium female humanoid or any Large or smaller cat who she has seen and whose appearance she remembers. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Dream Theft.name: Dream Theft
Dream Theft.description: Aslynn can trap a dreaming mind in her siphoning heartstone. She can force the dreaming creature into a lucid body and enter its dreamscape (@Check[will|dc:27] save negates). There, if the creature's lucid body would be killed, she can trap the creature's dreaming mind within her siphoning heartstone, causing the creature's body to remain in a mindless coma indefinitely.

Ethereal Spying.name: Ethereal Spying
Ethereal Spying.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Aslynn plucks an ethereal eye from the air and sends it off to do her spy work. The eye has AC 18, HP 1, and a fly speed of 60 feet. Aslynn can see through this eye and move it in any direction using a single action.

Spell Ambush.name: Spell Ambush
Spell Ambush.description: A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the night hag takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.

Nightmarish Wounds.name: Nightmarish Wounds
Nightmarish Wounds.description: Wounds caused by Aslynn's claws cause creatures to dwell on their worst nightmares. A creature damaged by Aslynn's claw must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 day.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Aslynn the Dream Taker.name: Aslynn the Dream Taker
Aslynn the Dream Taker.publicNotes:
Night hags are thieves and merchants of mortal souls. These foul creatures collect souls in dark gems or crystalline jars to sell in fiendish markets, and are themselves empowered by potent magic jewels known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.yhw1mr4oDhzMQc3D]{Heartstones}. They haunt the Ethereal Plane, where they prey upon mortals in their dreams, debilitating them with horrific nightmares as they rest. A night hag may find a particular target and haunt them continuously over the course of weeks, slowly and cruelly breaking down the victim's will and ability to resist, until their soul is forfeit.

A night hag is a canny mastermind and soul broker, willing to consider any deal as long as she is convinced she has the upper hand. Although a night hag finds it easy to travel the Ethereal Plane and prey upon helpless souls that can't fight back, these souls are also the least desirable to the evil outsiders the night hag bargains with, and so a night hag gathers allies and minions that allow her to prey on more potent souls without personally risking herself. Their favored minions are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qRUqoezeEnQ2KdyT]{Nightmares}, with whom they share a special bond.

Above all, night hags avoid fighting foes that can harry them on the Ethereal Plane, picking fights only when they are certain they can escape.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.RqX0vfUjlycKjGyp]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.
Aslynn the Dream Taker.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, -2 to all saves (if heartstone is lost)

Smokesight Hunter Wight.name: Smokesight Hunter Wight
Smokesight Hunter Wight.publicNotes:
Dangers deep in the wilderness claim the life some lone scout or hunter. When they arise as wights, they renew their hunt with equal vigor, but all the living are now their prey. Hunter wights prefer to seek strategic ground, frequently taking residence atop hills or within abandoned watchtowers and keeps.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The hunter wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Final Snare.name: Final Snare
Final Snare.description:
Trigger The hunter wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The hunter wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing @Damage[4d8[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]).

Spawn Hunter Wight.name: Spawn Hunter Wight
Spawn Hunter Wight.description: A living humanoid killed by a hunter wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the hunter wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn hunter wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a hunter wight spawn. If the creator of the hunter wight spawn dies, the hunter wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous hunter wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn hunter wight, and are no longer clumsy

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 7 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:22|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Death Drop (5-6).disable: @Check[occultism|dc:23] (trained) to disperse the force or @Check[religion|dc:21] (trained) to hide from the ominous presence's senses
Death Drop (5-6).stealthdetails: (trained) to sense an ominous presence in the room

Shove.name: Shove
Shove.description:
Trigger A creature spends one minute in the haunted chamber

Effect A powerful force sweeps across the room, shoving all creatures within it toward the doorway. Each creature in the room must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:23] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is shoved through the doorway. They can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} as a reaction. If they fail, they fall to the ground below, taking the damage from the failure entry.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet into the empty air and falls to the ground 60 feet below. They cannot attempt to Grab an Edge.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature also collides with several cables on the way down, taking an additional @Damage[(2d8 + 6)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Death Drop (5-6).name: Death Drop (5-6)
Death Drop (5-6).hazarddescription: An invisible force shoves creatures backwards, hurling them through the chamber's doorway.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night
Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Mist Evasion.name: Mist Evasion
Mist Evasion.description:
Trigger The vampire count would take damage from a critical hit, or from critically failing a saving throw against a damaging effect.

Effect The vampire count's body briefly evaporates into the surrounding mists, dispersing the triggering attack. The attack has the results of a failure instead of a critical success.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into its animal form or back into its normal form.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}

    • Size Large
    • Senses Echolocation 40 feet
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet
    • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+13 #Fangs]]{+13}/[[/r 1d20+8 #Fangs]]{+8}/[[/r 1d20+3 #Fangs]]{+3}, Damage @Damage[(1d8+7)[piercing]] damage

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Create Spawn.name: Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|dc:22|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Weak Evasive Vampire Count.name: Weak Evasive Vampire Count
Weak Evasive Vampire Count.publicNotes:
Vampire counts rule their demesnes through a mix of fear and cruelty.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Weak Evasive Vampire Count.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 7, void healing

Smokesight Wight Commander.name: Smokesight Wight Commander

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 12 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:29|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The wight commander ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Final Spite.name: Final Spite
Final Spite.description:
Trigger The wight commander is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The wight commander blows a battered war horn before being destroyed. The unnerving blast summons reinforcements, raising [[/r 1d4 #Corpses]]{1d4 corpses} in a @Template[emanation|distance:200] as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.DBTbqI9QQRtlJwWh]{Wights}.

Coordinated Strike.name: Coordinated Strike
Coordinated Strike.description: The wight commander flanks with an ally as long as the target is within both their reaches, even if commander and ally aren't on opposite sides.

Spawn Wight Soldier.name: Spawn Wight Soldier
Spawn Wight Soldier.description: A living humanoid killed by a wight commander's weapon or claw Strike rises as a wight of the commander's level or lower, most often a hunter wight or prowler wight, after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the wight commander that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn wight soldier and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn wight soldier, and are no longer clumsy.

Tactical Direction.name: Tactical Direction
Tactical Direction.description: Each wight ally in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction until the end of their next turn.

Smokesight Wight Commander.publicNotes:
When the beloved leader of a military unit is raised as a wight, sometimes the spirits of their comrades return with them, creating a gestalt being of impeccable tactical acumen.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Animated Leather Armor (4-99).name: Animated Leather Armor (4-99)
Animated Leather Armor (4-99).publicNotes:
Suits of animated armor see use both as guardians and as training partners in high-end martial academies able to afford the extravagance. They are most often found in wizard laboratories and ancient dungeons.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

Construct Armor (Hardness 5).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 5)
Construct Armor (Hardness 5).description: Like normal objects, an animated armor has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated armor is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 13.

Runt (3-4).name: Runt (3-4)
Runt (3-4).publicNotes:
These squat, mud-brown drakes resemble scaly pit bulls with blunt, toothy snouts. The desert drake is the prairie drake's closest known relative, as both share a strong affinity for earth, can burrow through soil, and hack up balls of dirt that they aim at enemies. But whereas a desert drake is sleek and nimble, flying through lightning storms and siroccos with ease, the prairie drake has all the grace of a chicken, barely able to flutter clumsily up a low hill or over a boulder. Owing to their largely vestigial wings, it's no wonder prairie drakes prefer burrowing over soaring.

The average prairie drake has a temperament similar to that of a wicked child who delights in tormenting others. They ambush tiny animals from underground and play with their food thoroughly before eating. To assert their supremacy over other scrubland predators, prairie drakes knock down their rivals and attack them mercilessly. They often make grisly displays from the corpses of their foes to intimidate other would-be competitors.

Prairie drakes build and live in burrow mounds just beneath the surface of their environs. They make shallow tunnels in search of large insects, rodents, and ground snakes. Prairie drakes' presence helps to turn the topsoil and encourage new plant growth, supporting other animal life and making them a keystone species for the environment. Even their breath weapon leaves behind rich "drake soil," coveted by farmers and gardeners for the potent effects it has on plants. Being seen as "useful" or "beneficial" annoys most prairie drakes, who believe such a reputation makes them look weak and conflicts with their "apex predator" mystique. After they've gotten too much positive attention, a prairie drake is apt to murder a farm animal or destroy croplands only to prove that they're far from harmless.

Pinpoint Weakness.name: Pinpoint Weakness
Pinpoint Weakness.description:
Tsimaan points out a weakness of a creature within 30 feet. Tsimaan and all allies that can see and hear her gain a +1 status bonus to their attack and damage rolls against that creature until the beginning of her next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.Il7YN8zlu3dfw3IE]{Effect: Pinpoint Weakness}

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

-2 to All Saves (If Heartstone is Lost).name: -2 to All Saves (If Heartstone is Lost)

Aslynn's Gaze.name: Aslynn's Gaze
Aslynn's Gaze.description:
Aslynn gazes upon a creature, afflicting it with intense distress and a gnawing sense of impending doom; the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:28] save. Since this effect isn't visual, the creature doesn't need to be able to see Aslynn to be affected.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to Aslynn's gaze for 1 day.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Failure The target is frightened 1 and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and slowed 1 for 1 minute.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
Aslynn can takes on the specific appearance of any Medium female humanoid or any Large or smaller cat who she has seen and whose appearance she remembers. This doesn't change her Speed or her attack and damage bonuses with her Strikes but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Dream Theft.name: Dream Theft
Dream Theft.description: Aslynn can trap a dreaming mind in her siphoning heartstone. She can force the dreaming creature into a lucid body and enter its dreamscape (@Check[will|dc:25] save negates). There, if the creature's lucid body would be killed, she can trap the creature's dreaming mind within her siphoning heartstone, causing the creature's body to remain in a mindless coma indefinitely.

Ethereal Spying.name: Ethereal Spying
Ethereal Spying.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Aslynn plucks an ethereal eye from the air and sends it off to do her spy work. The eye has AC 18, HP 1, and a fly speed of 60 feet. Aslynn can see through this eye and move it in any direction using a single action.

Nightmarish Wounds.name: Nightmarish Wounds
Nightmarish Wounds.description: Wounds caused by Aslynn's claws cause creatures to dwell on their worst nightmares. A creature damaged by Aslynn's claw must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 day. On a critical failure, or if it gets hit again and fails its save a second time, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 day.

Spell Ambush.name: Spell Ambush
Spell Ambush.description: A creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the night hag takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to defend against her spells.

Aslynn.name: Aslynn
Aslynn.publicNotes:
Night hags are thieves and merchants of mortal souls. These foul creatures collect souls in dark gems or crystalline jars to sell in fiendish markets, and are themselves empowered by potent magic jewels known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.yhw1mr4oDhzMQc3D]{Heartstones}. They haunt the Ethereal Plane, where they prey upon mortals in their dreams, debilitating them with horrific nightmares as they rest. A night hag may find a particular target and haunt them continuously over the course of weeks, slowly and cruelly breaking down the victim's will and ability to resist, until their soul is forfeit.

A night hag is a canny mastermind and soul broker, willing to consider any deal as long as she is convinced she has the upper hand. Although a night hag finds it easy to travel the Ethereal Plane and prey upon helpless souls that can't fight back, these souls are also the least desirable to the evil outsiders the night hag bargains with, and so a night hag gathers allies and minions that allow her to prey on more potent souls without personally risking herself. Their favored minions are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.qRUqoezeEnQ2KdyT]{Nightmares}, with whom they share a special bond.

Above all, night hags avoid fighting foes that can harry them on the Ethereal Plane, picking fights only when they are certain they can escape.

Malevolent crones who lurk at the edges of civilization, hags use their deceptive, magical abilities to prey upon humanoids, manipulating and corrupting them. Some say hags arose from fey that became twisted by their inner selfishness. Hags gather together in covens for greater power, craft unique magical items known as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ACa9QlFqdmW4s2Th]{Hag Eyes}, and are known to replace infant humanoids with their own offspring-these children are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.RqX0vfUjlycKjGyp]{Changelings} who have the potential to become hags themselves.
Aslynn.allSaves: +2 status to all saves vs. magic, -2 to all saves (if heartstone is lost)

Smoke.name: Smoke
Smoke.description: 20 feet. Deimostride continually exhales black smoke that creates @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} in an aura around him. Deimostride and his riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (@Check[fortitude|dc:23] negates) and is then temporarily immune sickness from the smoke for 1 minute. Deimostride, his rider, any creature currently holding its breath (or that does not need to breathe), and any creature immune to poison are immune to the aura's sickened effect but not the concealment.

Flaming Gallop.name: Flaming Gallop
Flaming Gallop.description: Deimostride Strides or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing @Damage[(6d6-2)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic] save) once to each creature other than his rider that he moves adjacent to during its gallop.

Deimostride (9-10).name: Deimostride (9-10)
Deimostride (9-10).publicNotes:
The enormous greater nightmare is a more dangerous variety of nightmare, particularly valued for its ability to invade other realities with its rider.

Nightmares are flaming equine harbingers of death.

Wind-Up.name: Wind-Up
Wind-Up.description:
24 hours, @Check[thievery|traits:action:disable-a-device|dc:26], standby

For a clockwork to act, it must be wound with a unique key by another creature. This takes 1 minute. Once wound, it remains operational for the listed amount of time, usually 24 hours, after which time it becomes unaware of its surroundings and can't act until it's wound again. Some clockworks' abilities require them to spend some of their remaining operational time. They can't spend more than they have and shut down immediately once they have 0 time remaining. If it's unclear when a clockwork was last wound, most clockwork keepers wind all their clockworks at a set time, typically 8 a.m.

A clockwork that lists standby in its wind-up entry can enter standby mode as a 3-action activity. Its operational time doesn't decrease in standby, but it can sense its surroundings (with a -2 penalty to Perception). It can't act, with one exception: when it perceives a creature, it can exit standby as a reaction (rolling initiative if appropriate).

A creature can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} to wind a clockwork down (with a DC listed in the wind-up entry). For each success, the clockwork loses 1 hour of operational time. This can be done even if the clockwork is in standby mode.

Activate Defenses.description:
One of the soldier's external plates extends on a mechanical actuator to defend the soldier or an adjacent creature of the soldier's choice.

The creature gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of the soldier's next turn, or until it is no longer adjacent to the soldier, whichever comes first. The soldier can have no more than one plate extended at a time.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.ya8r3IdzQ7QGNH8N]{Effect: Activate Defenses}
Activate Defenses.name: Activate Defenses

Etheric Discharge.name: Etheric Discharge
Etheric Discharge.description: The controlled clockwork vessel releases arcs of void energy from the essence-gatherer on its back. Creatures within a @Template[emanation|distance:10] take @Damage[11d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:26|basic|options:area-effect]). The vessel can't use Etheric Discharge for [[/gmr 1d4 #Recharge Etheric Discharge]]{1d4 rounds}.

Possessed Clockwork Vessel.name: Possessed Clockwork Vessel
Possessed Clockwork Vessel.publicNotes:
Intricate, complex machines, clockworks are built with care by highly skilled engineers. Though their creation involves some amount of magic, they're primarily mechanical, packed with precision-tuned gears and springs working in concert.

The sturdy mainspring within a clockwork must be wound to provide the energy needed to power the device. Some larger clockworks contain a series of springs for different limbs that each need to be wound. A clockwork's crafter creates a unique metal key while building the clockwork; winding the clockwork usually involves inserting the key into the machine's back and turning clockwise. Larger clockworks require greater strength to turn the key, and typically have larger keys to allow for more torque-some even accommodating a team of winders rather than an individual. Programming a clockwork requires both the key and the knowledge to set the program correctly, information usually reserved for the clockwork's creator or owner.

Urdefhan Blood Mage (PFS 4-11).name: Urdefhan Blood Mage (PFS 4-11)

Blood Offering.name: Blood Offering
Blood Offering.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The blood mage cuts themself and takes @Damage[8[slashing]] damage. If the blood mage's next action is to Cast a Spell, the action can't be disrupted, and if the spell has a range, the blood mage can increase that spell's range by 30 feet.

Wicked Bite.name: Wicked Bite
Wicked Bite.description:
Requirements The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on its last action

Effect The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The urdefhan chooses one of two options, each of which requires a fortitude save. If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood @Check[fortitude|dc:26] The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains @Damage[10[healing]] HP (or, on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains @Damage[20[healing]] HP).
  • Drain Vitality (necromancy) @Check[fortitude|dc:26|traits:necromancy] The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When an urdefhan dies, its invisible flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[emanation|distance:5] around the body.

This gas deals @Damage[8d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (@Check[fortitude|dc:24|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Urdefhan Blood Mage (PFS 4-11).publicNotes:
Hardened masters of occult power, urdefhan blood mages trade their blood for magical might. A heavily scarred blood mage is held in esteem by their fellow urdefhans, as it shows they have survived many bargains with eerie occult patrons.

Translucent-skinned scourges of the Darklands, urdefhans are remorseless killers and foot soldiers of the world's end.

Tactical Direction.description: Each wight ally in a @Template[emanation|distance:30] gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.hFtNbo1LKYCoDy2O]{Attack of Opportunity} reaction until the end of their next turn.
Tactical Direction.name: Tactical Direction

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The wight commander ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Final Spite.name: Final Spite
Final Spite.description:
Trigger The wight commander is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The wight commander blows a battered war horn before being destroyed. The unnerving blast summons reinforcements, raising [[/r 1d4 #Corpses]]{1d4 corpses} in a @Template[emanation|distance:200] as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.DBTbqI9QQRtlJwWh]{Wights}.

Coordinated Strike.name: Coordinated Strike
Coordinated Strike.description: The wight commander flanks with an ally as long as the target is within both their reaches, even if commander and ally aren't on opposite sides.

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 13 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:31|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Spawn Wight Soldier.name: Spawn Wight Soldier
Spawn Wight Soldier.description: A living humanoid killed by a wight commander's weapon or claw Strike rises as a wight of the commander's level or lower, most often a hunter wight or prowler wight, after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the wight commander that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn wight soldier and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a wight spawn. If the creator of the wight spawn dies, the wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn wight soldier, and are no longer clumsy.

Elite Smokesight Wight Commander.name: Elite Smokesight Wight Commander
Elite Smokesight Wight Commander.publicNotes:
When the beloved leader of a military unit is raised as a wight, sometimes the spirits of their comrades return with them, creating a gestalt being of impeccable tactical acumen.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Cute But Deadly.name: Cute But Deadly
Cute But Deadly.description: 30 feet. The sight of these bunnies with their red glowing eyes and sharp teeth is so unsettling that upon seeing them a creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:17] save. On a failure, that creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} on a critical failure) and cannot lower their frightened condition lower than 1 while within the aura. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune to all abyssal bunny swarm's cute but deadly auras for 1 minute.

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic] save). A creature that critically fails its save is becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1}.

Spellstrike.name: Spellstrike
Spellstrike.description: Nathatel channels a spell into a melee attack to deliver a magically charged attack. He Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into his attack instead. He makes a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack, which gains the arcane trait. His spell is coupled with the attack, using his attack roll to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty isn't applied until after he has completed the Spellstrike. After he uses Spellstrike, Nathatel can't do so again until he recharges this ability as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. He also recharges his Spellstrike when he casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9mPEoOPN0AMuixIv]{Force Fang} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r82rqcm0MmGaBFkM]{Thunderous Strike}.

Redirect Magic.description:
Trigger Nathatel succeeds at a save against a foe's harmful spell, or a foe fails a spell attack roll against him

Effect Nathatel redirects the spell's energy back at its caster. The caster takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage per spell rank (@Check[reflex|dc:23] negates). If the harmful spell dealt damage of a particular type, such fire damage, use that type instead of bludgeoning.
Redirect Magic.name: Redirect Magic

Nathatel (5-6).name: Nathatel (5-6)
Nathatel (5-6).privateNotes: Force damage from melee strikes and Cascade Countermeasure focus spell removed as Nathatel does not have Arcane Cascade per Alex from the Org Play Server. Focus Point value not changed from 3.

Children of the Night.description:
The vampire's presence brings forth creatures of the night to do the master's bidding. These typically include @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.6wPW2dvpt86Ou6bL]{Rat Swarms}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.2mg30nJR6P3HJDSd]{Bat Swarms}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.BN5Lb6IsQ9Wyu3rL]{Wolves}, but can include other creatures.

The vampire can give telepathic orders to these creatures as long as they are within 100 feet, but they can't communicate back.
Children of the Night.name: Children of the Night

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Mist Evasion.name: Mist Evasion
Mist Evasion.description:
Trigger Bolger would take damage from a critical hit, or from critically failing a saving throw against a damaging effect.

Effect Bolger's body briefly evaporates into the surrounding mists, dispersing the triggering attack. The attack has the results of a failure instead of a critical success.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Create Spawn.name: Create Spawn
Create Spawn.description:
If a creature dies after being reduced to 0 HP by Drink Blood, the vampire can turn this victim into a vampire by donating some of its own blood to the victim and burying the victim in earth for 3 nights.

If the new vampire is lower level than its creator, it is under the creator's control. If a vampire controls too many spawn at once (as determined by the GM), strong-willed spawn can free themselves by succeeding at a @Check[will|dc:29|name:Escape Thralldom] saving throw against the vampire's Will DC.

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The vampire transforms into its animal form or back into its normal form.

  • Bat The vampire changes into a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.xnpuGO8jEMba9wy5]{Giant Bat}

    • Size Large
    • Senses Echolocation 40 feet
    • Speed 20 feet, fly 30 feet
    • Melee fangs [[/r 1d20+17 #Fangs]]{+17}/[[/r 1d20+12 #Fangs]]{+12}/[[/r 1d20+7 #Fangs]]{+7}, Damage @Damage[(1d8+11)[piercing]] damage

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Dominate.name: Dominate
Dominate.description:
The vampire can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} at will as a divine innate spell. Casting it requires staring into the target's eyes, giving the spell the visual trait. The save DC uses the DC of the vampire's level, and a creature that succeeds is temporarily immune to that vampire's Dominate for 24 hours.

Fully destroying the vampire ends the domination, but merely reducing the vampire to 0 HP is insufficient to break the spell.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the vampire regains @Damage[10[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Bolger Trusk (5-6).name: Bolger Trusk (5-6)
Bolger Trusk (5-6).publicNotes:
Vampire counts rule their demesnes through a mix of fear and cruelty.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Bolger Trusk (5-6).hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 7, void healing

Adagio.name: Adagio
Adagio.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if no hostile creatures remain outside.

Sforzando.name: Sforzando
Sforzando.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the museum door without Fasiel's permission

Effect The trap rolls initiative as the paper birds attack. Wind and rain flurry through the area, applying a –2 circumstance penalty to ranged attacks and Perception checks, extinguishing non-magical fire, and impeding spells and abilities with the fire trait. Casters must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:6] or the action is disrupted.

Adagio.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:23] (trained) to create beautiful flying objects to complement the paper birds; @Check[acrobatics|dc:25] or @Check[performance|dc:22] (@Check[performance|dc:18] if using a flute) (trained) to perform along with the flute and paper birds (requires two successes); or one successful attack roll against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} Mehryar (AC 23, @Check[perception|dc:23] to determine Mehryar's location)
Adagio.hazarddescription: A flock of animated paper birds flit about to the playful sounds of an invisible flute, played by the invisible janni Mehryar.
Adagio.routine: (3 actions) On each of the trap's actions, the flock of paper birds attacks a different creature. On a successful hit, each target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:23] save. On a failure, they take @Damage[1d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.

Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess
Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger Halran critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with hisAldori dueling sword.

Effect Halran attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of his Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Halran take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand his language.

Living Boulder (PFS 4-04).name: Living Boulder (PFS 4-04)

Earth Glide.name: Earth Glide
Earth Glide.description: A living boulder can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.H6v1VgowHaKHnVlG]{Burrow} through earthen matter, including rock. When it does so, it moves at its full burrow Speed, leaving no tunnels or signs of its passing.

Rolling Charge.name: Rolling Charge
Rolling Charge.description: The living boulder Strides twice, and can then make a Strike with its jaws. This jaws Strike gains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.BCLvAx4Pz4MLa2pu]{Knockdown}.

Living Boulder (PFS 4-04).publicNotes: Living boulders roll and glide through the Plane of Earth, gathering gemstones and metal shards until their surfaces resemble a ship's hull covered in barnacles. Barely more intelligent than many animals, living boulders fill much the same role on the Plane of Earth as the great herd animals found on Material Plane worlds.

Swarming Bites.name: Swarming Bites
Swarming Bites.description: Each enemy in the swarm's space takes @Damage[5d4[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic] save).
