Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains @Damage[5[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The vampire spawn deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration
Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Cunning Vampire Spawn.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 5, void healing

In The Witch's Grasp.hazarddescription: Spectral hag claws reach out from the walls of the gem-like chamber to grab the PCs' souls and pull them into the trap's onyx facets.
In The Witch's Grasp.name: In The Witch's Grasp
In The Witch's Grasp.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25] (expert) or @Check[crafting|dc:25](expert) to find the weak spot and crack each facet, or dispel magic (4th level; counteract DC 23) to counteract each facet; the hazard has a number of facets equal to the number of PCs.
In The Witch's Grasp.routine:
The hazard gains a number of actions equal to the number of PCs; it loses 1 action each round for each facet that has been disabled. Each claw tears at a different PC, who takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[mental]] damage (@Check[will|dc:27|basic] save). On a failure, they are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} by the claw ([[/act escape dc=25]]). On a critical failure, or on a failure if they are already grabbed, they have their soul ripped from their body, which falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. Each round on their turn, the soul can attempt a @Check[intimidation|dc:25], @Check[occultism|dc:25], or @Check[survival|dc:25] check to fortify itself and return to its body as a three-action activity. The possible outcomes are as follows.

Critical Success The soul returns to their body, which loses the unconscious condition.

Success The soul returns to their body, which loses the unconscious condition, but gains the grabbed condition.

Failure The soul makes no progress toward escape.

Critical Failure The soul makes no progress toward escape and the target takes @Damage[(2d10+9)[mental]] damage until they are reduced to 0 Hit Points, after which they remain in captivity until the trap is defeated.

Each claw focuses on its target until the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points, after which it takes no action on its turn unless another facet is disabled or its target regains Hit Points.

Take Captive.description:
Trigger Pathfinder agents enter the electric castle

Effect Spectral hag claws emerge from the walls. The trap then rolls initiative.
Take Captive.name: Take Captive

Hallways Full of Even More Mostly Illuso.name: Hallways Full of Even More Mostly Illusory Opossums
Hallways Full of Even More Mostly Illuso.routine: (4 actions) The hazard loses 1 action each turn for each Disable success. Each sprite takes one action to Strike a different randomly chosen PC.

New Targets.name: New Targets
New Targets.description:
Trigger A creature walks into the room

Effect The sprites scream "Surprise!," attempt a opossum flyby Strike, and roll initiative.

prototypeToken.name: Hallways Full of Even More Mostly Illusory Opossums

Hallways Full of Even More Mostly Illuso.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:23], @Check[deception|dc:23], or @Check[intimidation|dc:23] four times to convince one sprite to undo their spells; @Check[athletics|dc:25], @Check[diplomacy|dc:25] (with wild empathy) or @Check[nature|dc:25] to subdue or soothe the opossums; or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 21) to undo one sprites' worth of spells. Four successes are required to disable the hazard.
Hallways Full of Even More Mostly Illuso.hazarddescription: Several distressed opossums dressed in school uniforms and under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.j8vIoIEWElvpwkcI]{Mirror Image} fly about the hallway, guided by four giggling sprites.

Elven Torchbearer.name: Elven Torchbearer
Elven Torchbearer.publicNotes:
Torchbearers carry a light sources for seasoned explorers and serve as apprentices.

The world is a wide, open place fraught with peril and adventure. Explorers use their knowledge of nature and survival skills to see every corner of the land.

Torch Combatant.name: Torch Combatant
Torch Combatant.description: A torchbearer is adept at attacking with torches and deals @Damage[1[persistent,fire]] damage when they critically hit with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.8Jdw4yAzWYylGePS]{Torch}.

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Rejection Vulnerability.name: Rejection Vulnerability
Rejection Vulnerability.description: As succubi are beings of pure lust, creatures that reject their lust can metaphysically harm them. When a succubus fails a Diplomacy check to Embrace or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request}, or when a creature succeeds at its save against a succubus's mental spell or ability, the succubus takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage. For one hour after causing mental damage to a succubus in this way, a creature can deal @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage to the succubus with a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.action-macros.Macro.nEwqNNWX6scLt4sc]{Demoralize} incorporating its rejection.

Seductive Presence.name: Seductive Presence
Seductive Presence.description: 10 feet. Any creature in the aura that could be sexually attracted to a succubus takes a -2 circumstance penalty to checks and DCs to oppose the succubus's mental spells, Deception, and Diplomacy.

Embrace.description: The succubus attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a creature using their Diplomacy bonus instead of Athletics. If the creature is willing, the succubus grapples it automatically.
Embrace.name: Embrace

Passionate Kiss.name: Passionate Kiss
Passionate Kiss.description:
Frequency Once per round.

Effect The succubus engages a creature they have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in an embrace or other act of passion to drain its vital essence. The kiss makes the creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} or increases its drained condition by 1, to a maximum of 4. The creature takes @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and the succubus regains Hit Points equal to the damage dealt. The target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or be affected by a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} to submit to more actions of passion rather than trying to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}.

Profane Gift.name: Profane Gift
Profane Gift.description:
Frequency once per day.

Effect The succubus on can give a willing humanoid a profane gift. That creature gains a +1 status bonus to attack rolls, skill checks, and saving throws. As long as the gift persists, the succubus can communicate telepathically with the target at any distance, see through the creature's senses, and target the creature with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} through the telepathic link. In addition, the creature uses an outcome one degree of success worse than it rolls on saving throws against the lust demon's suggestion.

A humanoid can't have more than one profane gift at a time, and a succubus can't grant more than one profane gift at a time. Removing the gift requires an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.7Fd4lxozd11MQ55N]{Atone} ritual. The succubus can remove the gift as a free action to give the recipient a permanent @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 3} condition. A 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.SnaLVgxZ9ryUFmUr]{Restoration} spell is required to reduce this stupefied condition by 1. A summoned succubus can't grant a profane gift.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.g5Yen1FhEMCzCJkv]{Effect: Profane Gift}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The succubus can take on the appearance of any Small or Medium humanoid. This doesn't change their Speed or their attack and damage modifiers with their Strikes, but it might change the damage type their Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Accursed Succubus.name: Accursed Succubus
Accursed Succubus.publicNotes:
Succubi are manifestations of the sin of destructive lust, and they are the most attractive of all demons-as befits their role in seducing mortals to fall to sin. The concept of gender is fluid to a succubus, as they can adopt countless humanoid forms of any gender to aid in their goals. Most succubi have a feminine true form (incubi, which usually have a masculine true form, are a different kind of demon), but regardless of gender, a lust demon is supernaturally beautiful or handsome, but with curving horns, bat wings, sharp claws, and a sinuous tail.

When disguised as a mortal humanoid on the Material Plane, a succubus whispers into the ears of mortals, urging them to pursue their darkest and most destructive desires and pushing them into depravity, using magic only if persuasion fails. While mortals often fixate on succubi's application of sexual lust, these demons are can easily exploit lust for power, knowledge, fame, or any other desire as easily as more carnal appetites. Their ability to infiltrate societies makes them excellent spies, assassins, and political saboteurs as well. Ultimately, the succubus enjoys all means of upending mortal culture.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Abyss, it can become a deadly fiend-a demon. Demons are living incarnations of sin-be they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more "specialized" depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demon's driving goals are twofold-the amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Abyss.
Accursed Succubus.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Aslynn's Eye.name: Aslynn's Eye
Aslynn's Eye.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. mind-affecting effects

+1 Status to All Saves Vs. Mental Effect.name: +1 Status to All Saves Vs. Mental Effects

Shattered Mirror.name: Shattered Mirror
Shattered Mirror.description: When an Aslynn's eye dies, their body explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:20] of jagged glass shards that deal @Damage[5d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:18|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Dream Eating.name: Dream Eating
Dream Eating.description:
An Aslynn's eye can consume the subconscious dreams of a creature within 30 feet; the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:21] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the Aslynn's eye's dream eating for 1 day.

Success Target takes @Damage[1d6[mental]] damage and Aslynn's eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the mental damage the target takes. If the target's Hit Points were lower than the damage dealt, the Aslynn's eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to their remaining Hit Points instead.

Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[2d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[4d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Mirror Travel.name: Mirror Travel
Mirror Travel.description: An Aslynn's eye can crawl into any mirror within their reach as if it were a door or window, instantly transporting them as well as any items they're wearing and holding to another mirror within 500 feet. The Aslynn's eye can remain within the mirror indefinitely or, provided they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability, they may choose to exit a mirror as part of any action they take with the Move trait. An Aslynn's eye can't exit a mirror unless they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability to take a specific creature's form. An Aslynn's eye can't exit a mirror that has the broken condition.

Mirrored Transformation.name: Mirrored Transformation
Mirrored Transformation.description: An Aslynn's eye takes the appearance of a mirrored version of any Large or smaller creature who they have seen and whose appearance they remember. While those who are not familiar with the subject of their mimicry may be fooled by the disguise, those who know the subject well automatically notice the mirroring effect. This ability doesn't change the Speed of the Aslynn's eye or their attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

Psychic Assault.name: Psychic Assault
Psychic Assault.description: The Aslynn's eye imbues their attacks with a psychic assault, infusing the mind of the creature struck with hideous nightmare visions and hallucinations. A creature damaged by the Aslynn's eye's fist must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:21] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the target is dazzled for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]] rounds and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The hunter wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Final Snare.name: Final Snare
Final Snare.description:
Trigger The hunter wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The hunter wight has rigged their own body with a snare, which they trigger before being destroyed. Slivers of bone launch at an adjacent creature, dealing @Damage[(4d8+4)[piercing]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:27|basic]).

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 8 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Spawn Hunter Wight.name: Spawn Hunter Wight
Spawn Hunter Wight.description: A living humanoid killed by a hunter wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the hunter wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn hunter wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a hunter wight spawn. If the creator of the hunter wight spawn dies, the hunter wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous hunter wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn hunter wight, and are no longer clumsy

Elite Smokesight Hunter Wight.name: Elite Smokesight Hunter Wight
Elite Smokesight Hunter Wight.publicNotes:
Dangers deep in the wilderness claim the life some lone scout or hunter. When they arise as wights, they renew their hunt with equal vigor, but all the living are now their prey. Hunter wights prefer to seek strategic ground, frequently taking residence atop hills or within abandoned watchtowers and keeps.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Giant Scorpion Venom.name: Giant Scorpion Venom
Giant Scorpion Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:20]

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[3d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[4d6[poison]] damage and enfeebled 1 (1 round)

Stage 3 4d6 poison damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} (1 round)

Mutated Scorpion.name: Mutated Scorpion
Mutated Scorpion.publicNotes:
These massive, terrifying arachnids are typically 8 feet long from head to the base of the tail. Giant scorpions are the favored pack animals and war beasts of various desert-dwelling monsters, particularly gnolls. They are most commonly encountered in the wild, however. There they lair in mountainside caves or burrow beneath shallow layers of sand where they lie in wait for prey to wander near. Sleek, pallid subterranean scorpions also exist, as do still larger species.

Chitinous scourges of deserts, forests, savannas, and badlands, scorpions are deadly arachnids with powerful pincers and a painful sting. Scorpions can be found in nearly every climate, where they hunt their prey with a mixture of patient stealth and raw strength. Most scorpions live in underground burrows, either as lone hunters or part of a larger colony. These arachnids are so feared and dangerous that in many cultures, they are treated as deities or dualistic symbols of both death and protection from said death.

Darkened Shadow Cannon.hazarddescription: A cannon built of cast iron and infused with shadow magic, mounted on the side of Aslynn's flying ship.

Load the Cannons.name: Load the Cannons
Load the Cannons.description:
Trigger The ship flies within 30 feet of Star

Effect The cannon rolls initiative.

Darkened Shadow Cannon.name: Darkened Shadow Cannon
Darkened Shadow Cannon.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:23] or @Check[thievery|dc:23] on the cannon's body to deactivate
Darkened Shadow Cannon.routine: (1 action) The cannon fires a blast that contains as many PCs as possible, choosing randomly in the event of a tie.

Combustive Zombie.name: Combustive Zombie
Combustive Zombie.publicNotes:
Glowing with a dull amber light, these odious creatures spawn from a combination of necromancy and fire. These destructive creations sow chaos and demolish fortifications, making them the bane of besieged cities.

Necromancers most often create these mindless undead as obedient, expendable servitors. Left to its own devices, a zombie seeks only to consume the living, stopping only when its rotting body can no longer hold together.

Slow.name: Slow
Slow.description: A combustive zombie is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

Death Throes.name: Death Throes
Death Throes.description: When a combustive zombie dies, its body explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:30] of fire and debris that deals @Damage[3d10[bludgeoning],3d10[fire]|options:area-damage]{3d10 bludgeoning damage and 3d10 fire damage} to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Blinding Sulfur.name: Blinding Sulfur
Blinding Sulfur.description: A combustive zombie burns with putrid inner fire. A creature hit by a combustive zombie's fist Strike must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:25] save. On a failure, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round, or for 1 minute on a critical failure.

Deimostride (7-8).name: Deimostride (7-8)
Deimostride (7-8).publicNotes: Nightmares are flaming equine harbingers of death.

(Trait) Experiment.name: (Trait) Experiment
(Trait) Experiment.description: This creature has the experiment trait. There is no description of what this trait is.

+2 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects, Disease, and Poison

Smoke.name: Smoke
Smoke.description: 15 feet. Deimostride continually exhales black smoke that creates @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealment} in an aura around him. Deimostride and his riders can see through this smoke. A creature that begins its turn in the area becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} (@Check[fortitude|dc:23] negates) and is then temporarily immune sickness from the smoke for 1 minute. Deimostride, his rider, any creature currently holding its breath (or that does not need to breathe), and any creature immune to poison are immune to the aura's sickened effect but not the concealment.

Flaming Gallop.name: Flaming Gallop
Flaming Gallop.description: Deimostride Strides or Flies up to triple its Speed. Its hooves burst with intense flame, dealing @Damage[(3d6+2)[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic] save) once to each creature other than his rider that he moves adjacent to during its gallop.

Deimostride (7-8).allSaves: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Death Effects, Disease, and Poison

Caustic Drool.name: Caustic Drool
Caustic Drool.description:
Caustic saliva drips from the warhound's mouth. Until the end of its turn, the abyssal warhound's jaws Strike deals an additional 2 points of acid damage on a successful attack, or 4 points on a critical success.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.5M3RGpOuxizPM5Iy]{Effect: Caustic Drool}

Shake.name: Shake
Shake.description:
Requirements The abyssal warhound's Caustic Drool ability is active

Effect The warhound shakes its head, splattering nearby creatures with caustic saliva. All creatures within 10 feet of the warhound take @Damage[2d4[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:14|basic]) and the warhound's Caustic Drool ability ends. Abyssal warhounds are immune to this damage.

prototypeToken.name: House Spirits With a Large Number of Regenerating Pies

House Spirits With a Large Number of Reg.name: House Spirits With a Large Number of Regenerating Pies
House Spirits With a Large Number of Reg.hp: if the house spirits take this much damage, they aren't killed, but they do flee the school and don't return
House Spirits With a Large Number of Reg.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:20], @Check[deception|dc:20], or @Check[intimidation|dc:20] four times to convince the spirits to undo their spells, @Check[arcana|dc:18] or @Check[occultism|dc:21] to unravel a pie's enchantments, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18) to undo one pies' worth of spells. Three successes are required to disable the hazard.
House Spirits With a Large Number of Reg.hazarddescription: A group of house spirits run around the lunchroom hurling pies at the walls and all the people in the room—and then the pies magically reconstitute and throw themselves again.
House Spirits With a Large Number of Reg.routine: (3 actions) The hazard regenerates any pies that it has thrown at a cost of one action per pie (to a maximum of 3 active pies). Each successful check to disable the hazard deactivates one of the pies, reducing the number of active pies by 1. After regenerating pies on its turn, the hazard throws pies whenever a creature triggers continually sur-piesed. For each pie Strike, roll [[/r 1d4]]. On a 1, the pie pan has nails driven into it by Numblekin and deals an additional @Damage[(1d10+6)[piercing]] damage. The nails make the pie's damage lethal, rather than nonlethal.

Sur-Pies.name: Sur-Pies
Sur-Pies.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room

Effect A pie from the room magically hurls itself at the creature and attempts a pie Strike, then the hazard rolls initiative.

Continually Sur-piesed.name: Continually Sur-piesed
Continually Sur-piesed.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room, attempts an action with the concentrate trait for the first time this turn, or ends their turn

Effect The hazard makes a pie Strike against the triggering creature.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Thisnabel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Sneak Attack.description: Thisnabel deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.
Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack

Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger The thief is targeted with a melee or ranged attack by an attacker it can see.

Effect The thief gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.
Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge

Mobility.name: Mobility
Mobility.description: When the thief Strides half their speed or less, that movement does not trigger reactions.

+1 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Traps.name: +1 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Traps

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: The thief isn't off-guard to creatures of 5th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.classfeatures.Item.w6rMqmGzhUahdnA7]{Surprise Attack}.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The thief deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if the thief rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to them.

Bloody Barber Thief.name: Bloody Barber Thief
Bloody Barber Thief.publicNotes:
Burglars specialize in breaking and entering to rob homes and businesses. These criminals focus on gaining access to secure buildings and bypassing traps and other security measures while remaining undetected all the while.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.
Bloody Barber Thief.allSaves: +1 circumstance to all saves vs. traps

Major Fireball Rune.hazarddescription: An invisible rune creates an invisible, spherical magical sensor with a 20-foot radius.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the sensor area

Effect The rune detonates a fireball centered on the triggering creature's square. This is a 5th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} spell that deals @Damage[10d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:28|basic]).

Major Fireball Rune.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:28] (expert) to erase the rune without triggering the sensor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (5th rank; counteract DC 26) to counteract the rune
Major Fireball Rune.name: Major Fireball Rune

Coven Grave Hag.name: Coven Grave Hag

Coven.name: Coven
Coven.description:
A grave hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gsYEuWv04XTDxe91]{Call Spirit} ritual to her coven's spells.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Coven]

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Sacrifice Ally.name: Sacrifice Ally
Sacrifice Ally.description:
Trigger The grave hag is adjacent to an ally when the hag is targeted by an attack or an effect that requires a Reflex saving throw

Effect The triggering effect is redirected to target the ally.

Grave Impressions.name: Grave Impressions
Grave Impressions.description:
The hag targets a living creature within 30 feet and overwhelms it with feelings of entombment. The target attempts a @Check[fortitude|dc:30] save and is then temporarily immune to the hag's Grave Impressions for 24 hours.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed} for 1 round.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

Critical Failure The target is unconscious and can't awaken for 1 hour.

Curse of the Grave.name: Curse of the Grave
Curse of the Grave.description:
The grave hag names a single creature within 30 feet; that creature must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:30] save or be afflicted with a grave curse equal to the hag's level. The curse lasts until the hag chooses to end it or is slain, rather than by returning items. Regardless of the save result, the target is then temporarily immune to the hag's grave curse for 24 hours.

Effect You are hounded by undead creatures of the same level as the curse. Every night, you must attempt a @Check[flat|dc:15] check. On a failure, an incorporeal undead manifests to hassle and harry you throughout the night, retreating before it can take much damage and often preventing you from gaining a full night's rest. Whenever you enter a graveyard or other area where bodies are buried, you must succeed at the same flat check or a body animates as a corporeal undead (typically a skeleton or zombie) to attack you.

These undead are temporary and exist only to harry you; if you take control of the undead, move on, or otherwise avoid their attacks, incorporeal undead discorporate and corporeal undead collapse into ordinary corpses. The curse can be removed by returning the stolen items to their resting place.

Grave's Grip.name: Grave's Grip
Grave's Grip.description: Creatures @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the grave hag take a -1 circumstance penalty to saving throws against the grave hag's spells and abilities.

Undead Mien.name: Undead Mien
Undead Mien.description: A grave hag appears as an undead creature to magical effects.

Coven Grave Hag.publicNotes:
Rot-skinned grave hags usually lair in cemeteries, mausoleums, and other burial sites; unlike most hags, they can't alter their appearance into a comely shape, so they hide from most observers. Grave hags consider such a predatory life hiding out in graveyards to be pitiful and squalid-they prefer to dwell in lands where necromancy is common and undeath isn't unusual. These grave hags become adept at necromantic magic and love posing as scholars. Schemers and plotters, they surround themselves with minions whom they send on missions to collect corpses for ghastly rituals.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
Coven Grave Hag.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess
Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger Dura critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with her Aldori dueling sword.

Effect Dura attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of her Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Dura take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand her language.

Runt (1-2).name: Runt (1-2)
Runt (1-2).publicNotes:
These squat, mud-brown drakes resemble scaly pit bulls with blunt, toothy snouts. The desert drake is the prairie drake's closest known relative, as both share a strong affinity for earth, can burrow through soil, and hack up balls of dirt that they aim at enemies. But whereas a desert drake is sleek and nimble, flying through lightning storms and siroccos with ease, the prairie drake has all the grace of a chicken, barely able to flutter clumsily up a low hill or over a boulder. Owing to their largely vestigial wings, it's no wonder prairie drakes prefer burrowing over soaring.

The average prairie drake has a temperament similar to that of a wicked child who delights in tormenting others. They ambush tiny animals from underground and play with their food thoroughly before eating. To assert their supremacy over other scrubland predators, prairie drakes knock down their rivals and attack them mercilessly. They often make grisly displays from the corpses of their foes to intimidate other would-be competitors.

Prairie drakes build and live in burrow mounds just beneath the surface of their environs. They make shallow tunnels in search of large insects, rodents, and ground snakes. Prairie drakes' presence helps to turn the topsoil and encourage new plant growth, supporting other animal life and making them a keystone species for the environment. Even their breath weapon leaves behind rich "drake soil," coveted by farmers and gardeners for the potent effects it has on plants. Being seen as "useful" or "beneficial" annoys most prairie drakes, who believe such a reputation makes them look weak and conflicts with their "apex predator" mystique. After they've gotten too much positive attention, a prairie drake is apt to murder a farm animal or destroy croplands only to prove that they're far from harmless.

Aslynn's Sharper Eye.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. mind-affecting effects

Mirrored Transformation.name: Mirrored Transformation
Mirrored Transformation.description: An Aslynn's sharper eye takes the appearance of a mirrored version of any Large or smaller creature who they have seen and whose appearance they remember. While those who are not familiar with the subject of their mimicry may be fooled by the disguise, those who know the subject well automatically notice the mirroring effect. This ability doesn't change the Speed of the Aslynn's sharper eye or their attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes but might change the damage type their Strikes deal.

Psychic Assault.name: Psychic Assault
Psychic Assault.description: The Aslynn's sharper eye imbues their attacks with a psychic assault, infusing the mind of the creature struck with hideous nightmare visions and hallucinations. A creature damaged by the Aslynn's sharper eye's fist must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round. On a critical failure, the target is dazzled for [[/gmr 1d4 #Rounds]] rounds and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 round.

+1 Status to All Saves Vs. Mental Effect.name: +1 Status to All Saves Vs. Mental Effects

Shattered Mirror.name: Shattered Mirror
Shattered Mirror.description: When an Aslynn's eye dies, their body explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:20] of jagged glass shards that deal @Damage[7d6[slashing]|options:area-damage] damage to each creature in the area (@Check[reflex|dc:21|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Dream Eating.name: Dream Eating
Dream Eating.description:
An Aslynn's sharper eye can consume the subconscious dreams of a creature within 30 feet; the creature must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and is temporarily immune to the Aslynn's sharper eye's dream eating for 1 day.

Success Target takes @Damage[(1d6+3)[mental]] damage and Aslynn's sharper eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the mental damage the target takes. If the target's Hit Points were lower than the damage dealt, the Aslynn's sharper eye gains temporary Hit Points equal to their remaining Hit Points instead.

Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[3d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure As success, but target takes @Damage[6d6[mental]] damage and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Mirror Travel.name: Mirror Travel
Mirror Travel.description: An Aslynn's sharper eye can crawl into any mirror within their reach as if it were a door or window, instantly transporting them as well as any items they're wearing and holding to another mirror within 500 feet. The Aslynn's sharper eye can remain within the mirror indefinitely or, provided they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability, they may choose to exit a mirror as part of any action they take with the Move trait. An Aslynn's sharper eye can't exit a mirror unless they're using their Mirrored Transformation ability to take a specific creature's form. An Aslynn's sharper eye can't exit a mirror that has the broken condition.

Aslynn's Sharper Eye.name: Aslynn's Sharper Eye

Emotion Sense.name: Emotion Sense
Emotion Sense.description: The potted violet etheroot can sense the emotions of creatures within 120 feet as an imprecise sense. Emotion sense is a precise sense against creatures under an emotion effect. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} or the serenity effect of the etheroot's Incite Emotion ability can't be noticed via emotion sense.

Soulfired Pot.name: Soulfired Pot
Soulfired Pot.description: The potted violet etheroot is rooted in a soulfired pot, which was glazed within a hellish kiln and which, like normal objects, has Hardness and grants the etheroot resistance to fire. This Hardness reduces any damage the etheroot takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the potted violet etheroot is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its soulfired pot breaks, it loses its resistance to fire, and its AC is reduced to 23. Breaking the pot also increases the etheroot's speed to 25 feet.

False Vision.name: False Vision
False Vision.description: The potted violet etheroot can trigger a false vision as the hallucination spell (@Check[will|dc:26]) in the mind of a target within 800 feet to hear and see an object, creature, or force of the etheroot's choice, which can draw upon the target's own understanding. For example, the etheroot would not have to be familiar with the target's father to create a hallucination of the target's father that looked and sounded like him. The false vision can be sustained up to 1 hour.

Incite Emotion.name: Incite Emotion
Incite Emotion.description:
Requirements The etheroot's last action was a success with a Strike using its stalked bite.

Effect Wounds caused by the potted violet etheroot's stalked bite can create an intense emotional response. The creature damaged by the etheroot's stalked bite is subjected to an effect of the etheroot's choice from the following (@Check[will|dc:25] save; duration 1 minute unless otherwise stated):

  • Despair: Target must attempt a Will save as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Wave of Despair} spell.
  • Fear: Target must attempt a Will save as if targeted by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} spell.
  • Hope: Target is affected as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IAjvwqgiDr3qGYxY]{Courageous Anthem} cantrip and must attempt a Will save to determine duration.

Critical Success The target is affected for 4 rounds.

Success The target is affected for 3 rounds.

Failure The target is affected for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is unaffected.

  • Serenity: Target must attempt a Will save as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} spell.

Tentacle Flurry.name: Tentacle Flurry
Tentacle Flurry.description: The potted violet etheroot makes two Strikes with two different tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. This counts as two attacks toward the etheroot's multiple attack penalty for further actions, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made.

It Pours.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if 2 minutes pass without a creature inside the room.

Bubble.name: Bubble
Bubble.description:
Trigger A creature touches anything in the room without Fasiel's permission

Effect The trap rolls initiative. A wall of water blocks the exits while the trap is active, making a shove attack ([[/r 1d20+22]]) toward the interior against any creature that moves into a doorway space.

It Pours.name: It Pours
It Pours.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:26] (trained) to scrape the flames away from the marid's image (requires two successes); @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 25) to disrupt the magical prison, disabling the trap for 10 minutes; or touch the amphora with Rayyan's seal to free the marid
It Pours.routine: (1 action) The trap has one action per round by default, though it may gain more actions based on the encounter's scaling as listed in the sidebar. On each of the trap's actions, the amphora pours out water, increasing the depth of the water by 5 feet. Once the room is full of water, creatures in the room begin drowning, and the trap deals @Damage[(2d10+9)[bludgeoning]] damage with a @Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save to each creature in the room on its action as the water pressure increases.
It Pours.hazarddescription: Water splashes within an ornate 5-foot-tall amphora. The glossy exterior depicts images of a marid trapped in a cage of flames, the frightened creature waving their hands in warning.

Barbed Net.name: Barbed Net
Barbed Net.description:
When a crumbling automaton hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. When a creature Escapes (DC 20), or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into nothing. Each time a creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, it takes @Damage[1d8[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HafP5vrdGdoqoFMo]{Effect: Barbed Net}

Dig-Widget (PFS 4-07).name: Dig-Widget (PFS 4-07)
Dig-Widget (PFS 4-07).publicNotes:
Thieves covet dig-widgets, specialized constructs built for infiltration. Each dig-widget contains numerous simple tools, including a set of mechanical devices that function as thieves' tools, two arms with drills, and two arms with corkscrews for attaching to and climbing surfaces. Once activated, these devices propel themselves forward. Though they have the full faculties typical of a construct, they usually follow a simple routine: avoid notice, pick any lock barring the path, dig past obstacles, and attack if caught. They're rarely left unattended, as a thief needs to be nearby to follow after-both to steal goods and to stop the dig-widget from engaging in further larceny once it's achieved its goal.

The source of a dig-widget's power is as much mechanical as it is magical. The gears and springs that provide a dig-widget mobility are an improvement over more primitive true clockwork creations (whose functions require constant winding to remain mobile), but at the cost of security, for a dig-widget's moving parts can be dismantled quickly by thieves and others with the proper training.

Infiltration Tools.name: Infiltration Tools
Infiltration Tools.description: A dig-widget's face consists of a set of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6nrCxNQFycUVFOV2]{Infiltrator Thieves' Tools}. They can be salvaged from a destroyed dig-widget with a successful @Check[crafting|dc:20|name:Salvage Infiltration Tools] check. On a failed check, the tools are destroyed.

Mechanical Vulnerability.name: Mechanical Vulnerability
Mechanical Vulnerability.description: Flaw in the construction of dig-widgets leave them vulnerable to disassembly. An adjacent creature with expert proficiency in Thievery can spend two actions to attempt a @Check[thievery|dc:20] check to Disable a Device to damage a dig-widget. If the check succeeds, the dig-widget takes [[/r 20]]{20 damage}.

Fastening Leap.name: Fastening Leap
Fastening Leap.description: The dig-widget Leaps up 20 feet onto a creature or object and attempts a corkscrew Strike against it. If the Strike damages the target, the dig-widget attaches to the target (typically to the back of a creature). This is similar to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-ability-glossary-srd.Item.Tkd8sH4pwFIPzqTr]{Grabbing} the creature, but the dig-widget moves with that creature rather than holding it in place. While attached, the dig-widget can't use its corkscrew. The dig-widget can be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shoved} off, or it can detach itself with an Interact action.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: A dig-widget's Strikes deal an additional 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Coffin Restoration.description: Unlike other undead, a vampire isn't destroyed at 0 HP. Instead, it falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. If its body rests in its coffin for 1 hour, the vampire gains 1 HP, after which its fast healing begins to function normally.
Coffin Restoration.name: Coffin Restoration

Vampire Weaknesses.name: Vampire Weaknesses
Vampire Weaknesses.description:
All vampires possess the following weaknesses.

  • Compulsions Vampires are creatures of strange and unknowable compulsions. A typical vampire can't voluntarily cross running water unless it is transported while it hides within its coffin, nor can it enter a private dwelling unless invited in by someone with the authority to do so. At your discretion, vampires might have different compulsions-a pirate vampire might not be able to set foot on solid ground without being invited, for example. The vampire can still be forced to do these things and might be able to overcome its compulsion just as it does its revulsion.
  • Revulsion A vampire can't voluntarily come within 10 feet of brandished garlic or a brandished religious symbol of a non-evil deity. To brandish garlic or a religious symbol, a creature must Interact to do so for 1 round (similar to Raising a Shield). If the vampire involuntarily comes within 10 feet of an object of its revulsion, it gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing} condition, running from the object of its revulsion until it ends an action beyond 10 feet. After 1 round of being exposed to the subject of its revulsion, a vampire can attempt a @Check[will|dc:25|name:Overcome Revulsion] save as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. On a success, it overcomes its revulsions for [[/gmr 1d6 #rounds]]{1d6 rounds} (or 1 hour on a critical success).
  • Stake A wooden stake driven through a vampire's heart drops the vampire to 0 HP and prevents it from healing above 0 HP, even in its coffin. Staking a vampire requires three actions and works only if the vampire is unconscious. If the stake is removed, the vampire can heal above 0 HP again, and if it's in its coffin the 1-hour rest period begins once the stake is removed. If the vampire's head is severed and anointed with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.z9T4c1hXwOotsMCp]{Holy Water} while the stake is in place, the vampire is destroyed.
  • Sunlight If exposed to direct sunlight, a vampire immediately becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1}. The slowed value increases by 1 each time the vampire ends its turn in sunlight. If the vampire loses all its actions in this way, it is destroyed. Due to their supernatural aversion to light, vampires don't cast shadows or show a reflection in mirrors.

Drink Blood.name: Drink Blood
Drink Blood.description:
Requirements A @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}, or willing creature is within the vampire's reach.

Effect The vampire sinks its fangs into that creature to drink its blood. This requires an @Check[athletics|defense:fortitude] check against the victim's Fortitude DC if the victim is grabbed and is automatic for any of the other conditions.

The victim is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the vampire regains @Damage[5[healing]] Hit Points, gaining any excess HP as temporary Hit Points. Drinking Blood from a creature that's already drained doesn't restore any HP to the vampire but increases the victim's drain value by 1. A vampire can also consume blood that's been emptied into a vessel for sustenance, but it gains no HP from doing so.

A victim's drained condition decreases by 1 per week. A blood transfusion, which requires a @Check[medicine|dc:20|name:Blood Transfusion] check and sufficient blood or a blood donor, reduces the drain by 1 after 10 minutes.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The vampire spawn deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn.name: Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn
Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn.publicNotes:
Vampires use their spawn for infiltration and reconnaissance.

Vampires are undead creatures that feed on the blood of the living.
Weak Cunning Vampire Spawn.hp: coffin restoration, fast healing 5, void healing

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The palace skelm can take on the appearance of any Medium male humanoid. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage bonuses with his Strikes but might change the damage type his Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Incite Violence.name: Incite Violence
Incite Violence.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The skelm gives an impassioned speech calling for his followers to act upon their convictions. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} must attempt a @Check[will|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature can immediately Strike an adjacent creature of its choosing.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature immediately Strikes an adjacent creature; if multiple creatures are adjacent, the skelm chooses the target. If no creatures are adjacent, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} with the skelm until the start of its next turn.

-2 to All Saves vs. Emotion Effects.name: -2 to All Saves vs. Emotion Effects

Corrupt Speech.name: Corrupt Speech
Corrupt Speech.description:
Trigger The skelm hears a creature speak within 30 feet

Effect The skelm sows paranoia by putting treacherous words on another's lips. The skelm whispers up to 12 words and attempts a @Check[deception|defense:perception] check against the Perception DC of a creature other than the triggering creature within 30 feet.

Critical Success The target hears the skelm's words as if they were spoken by the triggering creature. This can alter linguistic effects. The skelm also casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Mkbq9xlAUxHUHyR2]{Paranoia} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qwlh6aDgi86U3Q7H]{Suggestion} on the target, if he likes.

Success As critical success, except the skelm can't cast paranoia or suggestion.

Failure The target doesn't hear the skelm's words, and they have no effect.

Critical Failure The target hears the skelm speak the words.

Transformed Bremix (7-8).name: Transformed Bremix (7-8)
Transformed Bremix (7-8).publicNotes:
Skelms crave power, and the palace skelms who stalk the halls where such power concentrates are among the most dangerous of their kind. They assume titles that allow them maximum freedom to punish or hurt others with minimal oversight: any vindictive guard captain, tyrannical viceroy, or needlessly cruel magistrate could be or become a palace skelm. They delight in the wealth and status of their positions, garbing themselves in ornate finery that reflects their station.

Palace skelms ingratiate themselves with powerful individuals and gather followers by stoking fears of losing long-held or hard-earned power-especially power gained through illicit means. They undermine their enemies by encouraging competition, jealousy, and outright paranoia by way of magic and false messages. These skelms possess an unnatural ability to twist spoken words and worm their manipulative magic into others' speech, sowing confusion and hatred that might explode into violence.

A political upheaval is a palace skelm's greatest fear and opportunity alike, upsetting the balance of power he has built but providing countless new opportunities to sow hatred and evil. This conflicting goal leads palace skelms to self-sabotage and undermine their own efforts more than any other skelm.

Rage-filled skelms are drawn to any settlement with more than a few hundred souls. Using magical disguises and leveraging societal norms to their benefit, these antlered monsters crave fearful respect and brutally punish any who dare disagree with their lofty opinions, even in the slightest degree. Although quite dangerous on their own, skelms are at their deadliest when leading an angry mob. Their cruel and exploitative nature has made their name synonymous with villainy.

An existing skelm can transform any evil humanoid who's overwhelmed with rage into one of their kind. Skelms heap enraging humiliation on potential new brothers as a form of indoctrination, convincing these recruits that some other person or group is responsible for their misery. This practice ensures skelms begin their new existence with sufficient vitriol to plot their revenge.

Many newly forged skelms carry on their lives in the roles they held as mortals; and in fact, these roles often shape the type of skelm they become. Skelms can arise among members of nearly any ancestry, though they're more common among cultures with deeply entrenched gender roles, unjust hierarchies, and those that don't offer healthy ways to experience and process anger.
Transformed Bremix (7-8).allSaves: -2 to all saves vs. emotion effects

Nimble Dodge.name: Nimble Dodge
Nimble Dodge.description:
Trigger The gang leader is targeted with an attack by an attacker they can see

Effect The gang leader gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, if the gang leader rolls Deception or Stealth for initiative, creatures who haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the gang leader.

Brutal Rally.name: Brutal Rally
Brutal Rally.description:
Trigger The gang leader rolls a critical hit against a creature

Effect All allies that can see the gang leader gain a +1 circumstance bonus to attack rolls until the start of the gang leader's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.7x0O2GqWBJiAk5PF]{Effect: Brutal Rally}

Deny Advantage.name: Deny Advantage
Deny Advantage.description: The gang leader isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to creatures of 7th level or lower that are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, flanking, or using surprise attack.

Evasion.name: Evasion
Evasion.description: When the gang leader rolls a success on a Reflex save, they get a critical success instead.

Gang Up.name: Gang Up
Gang Up.description: Any enemy is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the gang leader's melee attacks due to flanking as long as the enemy is within melee reach of both the gang leader and one of the gang leader's allies.

Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
Quick Draw.description: The gang leader @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon, then Strikes with that weapon.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The gang leader deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Bloody Barber Gang Leader.name: Bloody Barber Gang Leader
Bloody Barber Gang Leader.publicNotes:
Cutthroats, killers, thieves, and toughs prey upon the vulnerable of society. Directing their activities and keeping them in line are the duties of the gang leader.

Villains pursue selfish and cruel goals, trampling over anyone foolish or purehearted enough to stand in their way.

Spawn Stalker Wight.name: Spawn Stalker Wight
Spawn Stalker Wight.description: A living humanoid killed by a stalker wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a stalker wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the stalker wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn stalker wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a stalker wight spawn. If the creator of the stalker wight spawn dies, the stalker wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous stalker wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn stalker wight, and are no longer clumsy

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The stalker wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Final Spite.name: Final Spite
Final Spite.description:
Trigger The stalker wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The stalker wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When the stalker wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 8 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:24|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the stalker wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Feign Death.name: Feign Death
Feign Death.description: The stalker wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 37 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The stalker wight deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Elite Smokesight Stalker Wight.name: Elite Smokesight Stalker Wight
Elite Smokesight Stalker Wight.publicNotes:
Often found lurking in the dark, prowler wights wield subterfuge as their greatest weapon. They frequently feign death in old sewers, graveyards, and mausoleums, waiting for hapless victims to pass by before striking.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Sedation.name: Sedation
Sedation.description:
Trigger A creature moves into the flowers' space

Effect The pollen in the suncatcher blooms puffs out in a 5-foot burst. All creatures in the area must each attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:18] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and is immune to the effects of suncatcher bloom pollen for 24 hours.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} 1 for 1 minute.

Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied} 1 for 1 hour and immediately falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. They do not fall prone or release what they are holding, and they can still wake up normally with a successful Perception check. If they are still unconscious after 1 minute, they wake up automatically.

Critical Failure Same as failure, except the creature wakes up automatically after 1 hour instead of after 1 minute.

Suncatcher Blooms (1-2).name: Suncatcher Blooms (1-2)
Suncatcher Blooms (1-2).disable: @Check[survival|dc:18] (trained) to safely move through the flowers without activating the pollen.
Suncatcher Blooms (1-2).hazarddescription: Bright, iridescent blue petals sprout from the cerulean center of this flower.

Bloodline Magic.name: Bloodline Magic
Bloodline Magic.description:
When Larcuis casts a bloodline spell, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IihxWhRfpsBgQ5jS]{Enthrall}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.2ZdHjnpEQJuqOYSG]{Floating Flame}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, either a target takes 1 fire damage per spell rank, or he gains a +1 status bonus to Deception checks for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.tvybMInVm415jA3p]{Effect: Bloodline Magic (+1 deception)}

Dangerous Sorcery.name: Dangerous Sorcery
Dangerous Sorcery.description: When Larcuis Casts a Spell from a spell slot, if the spell deals damage and doesn't have a duration, he gains a status bonus equal to the spell's rank to that spell's damage.

Urdefhan High Tormentor (PFS 4-11).name: Urdefhan High Tormentor (PFS 4-11)

Necrotic Decay.name: Necrotic Decay
Necrotic Decay.description:
When an urdefhan dies, its invisible flesh quickly rots away and sublimates into a foul-smelling gas that fills a @Template[emanation|distance:5] around the body.

This gas deals @Damage[10d6[void]|options:area-damage] damage to creatures in this area as their flesh curdles and rots as well (@Check[fortitude|dc:29|basic|options:area-effect] save).

Stoke the Fervent.name: Stoke the Fervent
Stoke the Fervent.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect The urdefhan lets out a battle cry, sending itself and its allies into a fanatical frenzy. Each ally that hears the call gains a +4 status bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls, a +2 status bonus to saving throws, and takes a -2 status penalty to AC. Affected allies must use at least one of their actions to Strike each round, if they are able (even if it means attacking an ally, object, or thin air).

This lasts for [[/br 2d4 #rounds]]{2d4 rounds}.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.J6EwMsXtXg30eaiB]{Effect: Stoke the Fervent (High Tormentor)}

Wicked Bite.name: Wicked Bite
Wicked Bite.description:
Requirements The urdefhan damaged a creature with a jaws Strike on its last action

Effect The urdefhan maintains contact, turning the creature's flesh translucent around the site of the injury. The urdefhan chooses one of two options, each of which requires a @Check[fortitude|dc:29] save. If the jaws Strike was a critical hit, the creature suffers both effects, using the same save result for both.

  • Drain Blood The urdefhan drinks some of the creature's blood. On a failed save, the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} and the urdefhan regains @Damage[10[healing]] HP (or, on a critical failure, it's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2} and the urdefhan regains @Damage[20[healing]] HP).
  • Drain Vitality (necromancy) The urdefhan draws out some of the creature's vital essence. The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} for 1 hour on a failed save (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 1 hour on a critical failure).

Urdefhan High Tormentor (PFS 4-11).publicNotes:
An urdefhan cult's best tormentors can advance to become truly formidable daemon summoners.

Urdefhans believe themselves to be spawn of the First Horseman of the Apocalypse, who planted them on the Material Plane to serve as harbingers of the end times. These warmongering humanoids live in groups called cults in the Darklands vaults of Orv

The violent warmongers, occultists, and poisoners known as urdefhans dwell within the Darklands. They were created in eons past by the mysterious First Horsemen of the Apocalypse to serve as agents of the end times within the Material Plane. Urdefhans continue to honor their creators by worshipping the wretched beings who rule over the plane of Abaddon, and like their fiendish lieges, urdefhans exist for one reason and one reason alone: to kill.

While urdefhans are humanoid and dwell together in large groups, this is where their similarities to surface ancestries end. Their visages are horrific, with transparent skin and musculature displaying their glistening entrails, gleaming bones, and perhaps worst of all, their baleful red eyes. This, combined with their gaping maws full of sharp fangs, works to create the false impression that these beings are some sort of vampiric undead, not creatures of living flesh and blood. When an urdefhan's life comes to an end, their flesh quickly curdles and then bursts in a wave of awful corruption that spreads to the flesh of other creatures in the area. The typical urdefhan views their eventual demise as a disappointment, for once they're dead, their chances to kill will finally come to an end.

Urdefhans' primary concern is death and how to inflict it in the goriest, most painful, and widespread ways. Beyond this ethos of violence, urdefhans concern themselves only tangentially with matters such as formal modes of warfare or aspects of their damnable religion. When an urdefhan is not actively engaged in violence, their giddy cruelty is tempered only by a sense of self-preservation that ensures they survive long enough to spread the "blessings" of their daemonic patrons. They pass the time between wars inventing new weapons, developing new diseases, and researching awful new magic, all in preparation for the next inevitable conflict.

Allegro.name: Allegro
Allegro.hazarddescription: A flock of animated paper birds flit about to the playful sounds of an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} flute, played by the invisible janni Mehryar
Allegro.disable: @Check[crafting|dc:26] (trained) to create beautiful flying objects to complement the paper birds; @Check[acrobatics|dc:28] or @Check[performance|dc:25] (@Check[performance|dc:21] if using a flute) (trained) to perform along with the flute and paper birds (requires two successes); or one successful attack roll against the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} Mehryar (AC 25, @Check[perception|dc:25] to determine Mehryar's location)
Allegro.routine: (3 actions) On each of the trap's actions, the flock of paper birds attacks a different creature. On a successful hit, each target must attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:26] save. On a failure, they take @Damage[2d6[persistent,bleed]] damage.
Allegro.reset: The trap deactivates and resets if no hostile creatures remain outside.

Sforzando.name: Sforzando
Sforzando.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the museum door without Fasiel's permission

Effect The trap rolls initiative as the paper birds attack. Wind and rain flurry through the area, applying a –2 circumstance penalty to ranged attacks and Perception checks, extinguishing non-magical fire, and impeding spells and abilities with the fire trait. Casters must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:6] or the action is disrupted.

Depleted Roiling Incant.name: Depleted Roiling Incant
Depleted Roiling Incant.publicNotes:
Though many spellcasters can harness the forces of magic in a consistent manner, such power can't always be controlled, especially in the hands of reckless researchers, megalomaniacal villains, or untested novices. When magical accidents result in large-scale property damage and the loss of life, these forces sometimes take on lives of their own, forming a dangerous amalgamation of ongoing magical energy known as a roiling incant.

A roiling incant's appearance depends on the type of magic it sprang forth from, though it always carries with it an echo of the destruction it has caused. A fiery evocation roiling incant might look like a storm of burning ashes echoing with the sounds of crackling timber, while a necromancy roiling incant could be mistaken for ghostly tendrils puppeteering shambling corpses. No matter what it looks like, a roiling incant roams mindlessly, attacking everything it encounters, heedless of further carnage it causes.

Absorb Evocation.name: Absorb Evocation
Absorb Evocation.description: A roiling incant is made of evocation energy. Any time it would be affected by another creature's non-cantrip evocation spell, after applying its immunity, it also regains @Damage[5[healing]] Hit Points.

Engulf.name: Engulf
Engulf.description:
@Check[reflex|dc:25], @Damage[2d6[force],3d4[fire]]{2d6 force damage plus 3d4 fire damage}, [[/act escape dc=25]], Rupture 15

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.Engulf]

Unstable Magic.name: Unstable Magic
Unstable Magic.description:
A roiling incant is as much a mass of unstable magic as it is a creature. Is isn't living or undead, nor is it even a construct. It can't be healed or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.bT3skovyLUtP22ME]{Repaired} and is destroyed at 0 Hit Points, though it naturally recovers a number of Hit Points equal to its level × its Constitution modifier (@Damage[42[healing]] for most depleted roiling incants) each day.

Each time a roiling incant casts one of its non-cantrip spells, it drains its own magic to do so, taking @Damage[5[force]] damage.

Scrap Tempest.name: Scrap Tempest
Scrap Tempest.description: The infested clockwork heap unleashes a cloud of loosely connected debris that whirls around its body at incredible speed. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} takes @Damage[2d10[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:22|basic|options:area-effect]).

Overburden.name: Overburden
Overburden.description:
Requirements The infested clockwork heap's last action was a success with an infested touch Strike

Effect A fragment of the infesting spirit attaches to the target's clothing or armor, making the creature encumbered. The encumbered condition from Overburden disappears when the infested clockwork is destroyed or after 10 minutes, whichever comes first.

Fence's Eye.name: Fence's Eye
Fence's Eye.description: Fences live by their ability to recognize a viable trade. They can use Underworld Lore to identify an item's value and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on an item. They gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Underworld Lore checks when doing so, and to Underworld Lore checks to determine whether an item was stolen, whether a stolen item would be too recognizable to easily move, and who would be interested in purchasing such an item.

Quick Rummage.name: Quick Rummage
Quick Rummage.description: The fence always has a few items close at hand. The fence @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.pvQ5rY2zrtPI614F]{Interacts} to draw a weapon or item that takes a single action to activate, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VjxZFuUXrCU94MWR]{Strikes} with the weapon or activates the item.

Scoundrel's Feint.name: Scoundrel's Feint
Scoundrel's Feint.description: When the fence successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feints}, their target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the fence's attacks until the end of the fence's next turn. On a critical success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against all attacks until the end of the fence's next turn.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The fence deals an extra 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Elven Fence.name: Elven Fence
Elven Fence.publicNotes:
The longer criminals hold on to stolen loot, the greater the chance they will get caught. Fences make themselves indispensable in the underworld by paying for stolen goods in order to resell them later, whether through a seemingly legitimate business or to a closed group of elite buyers.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess
Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger Halran critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with hisAldori dueling sword.

Effect Halran attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of his Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Halran take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand his language.

Snakebush (1-2).name: Snakebush (1-2)

Snakebite.name: Snakebite
Snakebite.description:
Trigger A creature gathers unripe berries from the bush.

Effect A nearby branch warps into a viper's head and Strikes at the creature.

Snakebush (1-2).hazarddescription: The branches of this peculiar bush are heavy with ripening berries.

Bugbear Trickster.name: Bugbear Trickster
Bugbear Trickster.publicNotes: These stealthy and cruel goblinoid creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaks of boards to build lurking dread and arouse suspicion and fear.

Kick Sand.name: Kick Sand
Kick Sand.description:
The creature kicks sand into an adjacent creature's face. That creature makes a @Check[reflex|dc:19|basic]. On a failure, that creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and treated as @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to this creature's next attack; a success negates the off-guard effects.

Note: A DC was not provided for this ability by Paizo. The DC present here is a moderate DC for the creature level according to the Gamemastery Guide creature building Tables.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The bugbear trickster deals 1d8 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Rhenei gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Darkened Shadow Cannon (4-17).name: Darkened Shadow Cannon (4-17)
Darkened Shadow Cannon (4-17).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:24] or @Check[thievery|dc:24] to disrupt the cannon; two checks are required to disable it
Darkened Shadow Cannon (4-17).hazarddescription: A cannon built of cast iron and infused with shadow magic, mounted on the side of Aslynn's flying ship.
Darkened Shadow Cannon (4-17).routine: (three actions) The cannon fires a blast that contains as many PCs as possible, choosing randomly in the event of a tie, then reloads.

Load the Cannons.name: Load the Cannons
Load the Cannons.description:
Trigger The ship flies within 30 feet of a PC

Effect The cannon reloads and rolls initiative.

Shaitan Tactics (5-6).name: Shaitan Tactics (5-6)
Shaitan Tactics (5-6).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:23] (trained) or @Check[nature|dc:23] (trained) to contest the shaitan's control (requires two successes). Each success removes one of the traps actions.
Shaitan Tactics (5-6).hazarddescription: The shaitan observes the area from a distance, observing the battlefield as a game board. The ground trembles in response to the genie's enthusiasm.
