Shaitan Tactics (5-6).routine: (2 actions) On each of the trap's actions, the trap either moves a willing creature on the ground up to 30 feet without provoking reactions or makes a hostile creature on the ground @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round (@Check[acrobatics|dc:23] check or @Check[reflex|dc:23] save negates).
Shaitan Tactics (5-6).reset: The trap deactivates and resets once all hostile creatures leave A3 or surrender.

Opening Move.name: Opening Move
Opening Move.description:
Trigger The shaitan sees a non-genie creature threatening an ally

Effect The trap rolls initiative and the shaitan takes control of the floor in A3, making it difficult terrain for hostile creatures while the trap is active.

Snakebush (3-4).hazarddescription: The branches of this peculiar bush are heavy with ripening berries.
Snakebush (3-4).name: Snakebush (3-4)

Snakebite.name: Snakebite
Snakebite.description:
Trigger A creature gathers unripe berries from the bush

Effect A nearby branch warps into a vier's head and Strikes at the creature.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Rhenei gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Enduring Spittle.name: Enduring Spittle
Enduring Spittle.description: If abyssal drool critically hits a target, that creature also takes 1 persistent acid damage.

Ambush Scout.name: Ambush Scout
Ambush Scout.publicNotes:
Using their strength to bully others into submission, ruffians often work as bodyguards and enforcers for powerful criminals like charlatans and fences.

Some criminals are the desperate who have no option but to break the law to survive, while others choose a life of crime for thrills, forming gangs or underworld guilds that specialize in certain illegal ventures.

Brutal Beating.name: Brutal Beating
Brutal Beating.description: The scout's brutality shakes foes' confidence. When the scout deals damage on a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}, and the scout can knock the target up to 10 feet away (this is forced movement).

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The ruffian deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Snagging Strike.name: Snagging Strike
Snagging Strike.description:
Requirements The scout has one hand free, and its target is within reach of that hand

Effect The scout makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If this Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of the scout's next turn or until it leaves the scout's reach, whichever comes first.

Barbed Net.name: Barbed Net
Barbed Net.description:
When a crumbling automaton hits a creature with their barbed net, the net wraps around the target, which becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} and takes a –10-foot circumstance penalty to its Speeds. If the Strike was a critical success, the target is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}. When a creature Escapes (DC 17), or if the Strike misses, the net crumbles into nothing. Each time a creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape}, it takes @Damage[1d6[slashing]] damage from the net's barbs, regardless of whether the attempt succeeds.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.HafP5vrdGdoqoFMo]{Effect: Barbed Net}

Tandem Chop.name: Tandem Chop
Tandem Chop.description:
Trigger A creature or object within the ambush runner's reach is hit with a Strike by an ally using a weapon in the axe group

Requirements The ambush runner is holding a weapon in the axe group

Effect The ambush runner attempts a Strike against the same creature or object. If it hits, combine the damage with the damage from the triggering Strike for the purpose of Hardness, resistances, and weaknesses. A creature or object can only be the target of a single Tandem Chop per turn, regardless of the number of ambush runner in reach.

Death Drop (3-4).name: Death Drop (3-4)
Death Drop (3-4).disable: @Check[occultism|dc:20] (trained) to disperse the force or @Check[religion|dc:18] (trained) to hide from the ominous presence's senses
Death Drop (3-4).hazarddescription: An invisible force shoves creatures backwards, hurling them through the chamber's doorway.
Death Drop (3-4).stealthdetails: (trained) to sense an ominous presence in the room

Shove.name: Shove
Shove.description:
Trigger A creature spends one minute in the haunted chamber

Effect A powerful force sweeps across the room, shoving all creatures within it toward the doorway. Each creature in the room must attempt a @Check[fortitude|dc:20] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is shoved through the doorway. They can attempt a @Check[reflex|dc:20] save to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} as a reaction. If they fail, they fall to the ground below, taking the damage from the failure entry.

Failure The creature is pushed 10 feet into the empty air and falls to the ground 40 feet below. They cannot attempt to Grab an Edge.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature also collides with several cables on the way down, taking an additional @Damage[(1d10 + 5)[bludgeoning]] damage.

Construct Armor (Hardness 2).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 2)
Construct Armor (Hardness 2).description: Like normal objects, an animated dagger has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the dagger takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated dagger is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

Accursed Claws.name: Accursed Claws
Accursed Claws.description: Sounrel's claws carry her mother's hag magic. When she critically hits with a claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d4[persistent,mental]] damage.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Thisnabel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Thisnabel deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Nathatel (3-4).name: Nathatel (3-4)
Nathatel (3-4).privateNotes: Force damage from melee strikes removed as Nathatel does not have Arcane Cascade per Alex from the Org Play Server

Spellstrike.name: Spellstrike
Spellstrike.description: Nathatel channels a spell into a melee attack to deliver a magically charged attack. He Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into his attack instead. He makes a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack, which gains the arcane trait. His spell is coupled with the attack, using his attack roll to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty isn't applied until after he has completed the Spellstrike. After he uses Spellstrike, Nathatel can't do so again until he recharges this ability as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. He also recharges his Spellstrike when he casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9mPEoOPN0AMuixIv]{Force Fang} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r82rqcm0MmGaBFkM]{Thunderous Strike}.

Burrowing Viper Rat Venom.name: Burrowing Viper Rat Venom
Burrowing Viper Rat Venom.description:
Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:16]

Maximum Duration 4 rounds

Stage 1 @Damage[1d6[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 @Damage[1d8[poison]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Construct Armor (Hardness 2).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 2)
Construct Armor (Hardness 2).description: Like normal objects, an animated dagger has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage the dagger takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once an animated dagger is reduced to fewer than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks, and its Armor Class is reduced to 14.

Dream of Doom.name: Dream of Doom
Dream of Doom.publicNotes:
An animate dream coalesces from centuries of stray fragments of reverie and dream left behind as slumbering minds drift through the Dimension of Dreams. In most cases, these fragments simply disperse on their own, but when dreamers flee from nightmares back to the waking world, these fragments can take on a supernatural life of their own. They have little reasoning and intent except to seek similar fragments, absorb them, and grow. When enough of them gather together, they merge into a horrific form as an animate dream.

Individually, animate dreams can hold a wide range of appearances, but most take on rudimentary shapes akin to the living forms of the minds that spawned them. Animate dreams that rise from slumbering humanoids, the most commonly encountered, thus appear humanoid, but with distorted, nightmarish shapes that incorporate additional twisted limbs and frightening features. In these forms, animate dreams find their way out of the Dreamlands and into the waking world, only to discover they have no way of returning and suffer a relentless hunger that only new nightmares can sate.

An animate dream thrives on the terror fueled by nightmares and fear and uses its supernatural abilities to invoke such feelings in the minds of its victims, cursing its prey by creating a permanent link to that individual's dreams. Thereafter, the victim is subjected to all manner of reoccurring nightmares. As the nightmares continue, the victim finds it more and more difficult to remain awake. In the end, the victim plunges into an accursed slumber from which it cannot return. These victims provide the animate dream with the purest form of fear and are its preferred sustenance.

An animate dream can subsist on the ambient fear generated by regular nightmares, but these lesser fears aren't as satisfying, often driving the animate dream to seek out new victims. Left without a source of fear, an animate dream won't starve to death, but it will grow increasingly violent and desperate. Famished animate dreams are the ones most often encountered, as they have been forced to abandon subtlety to pursue more blatant methods of harvesting fear. Yet such animate dreams also tend to be the least powerful of their kind. Those who have grown metaphysically fat on fear have generally done so by adopting a specific nightmare theme, such as being buried alive, being swept away by ocean waves, or being consumed by wild beasts. Such animate dreams often have similarly themed innate spells to augment their powers.
Dream of Doom.allSaves: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

Imminent Demise.name: Imminent Demise
Imminent Demise.description: 15 feet. Creatures within the aura experience an acute awareness of their own mortality, and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} for as long as they remain within the aura. Creatures with the dream trait are immune to this ability.

Endless Nightmare.name: Endless Nightmare
Endless Nightmare.description:
An animate dream's touch fills the victim's mind with terrifying visions

Saving Throw @Check[fortitude|dc:24]

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} (1 day)

Stage 2 fatigued and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 The victim falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} and can't be awakened as long as they remain at this stage (1 day).

Recon Scout.name: Recon Scout
Recon Scout.publicNotes:
Some mercenaries eschew the complications of politics, oaths of service, and fealty and just get paid to hunt monsters. It's a straightforward form of mercenary service, often dangerous in the extreme, but one that can yield glory and fame.

A broad category that includes those wielding arms, spells, or even guile and cunning, mercenaries hire themselves and their expertise to those with the gold to pay for it.

Rage.name: Rage
Rage.description:
Requirements The recon scout isn't @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} or raging

Effects The recon scout gains 9 temporary Hit Points that last until the rage ends. While raging, they deal 8 additional damage with melee attacks, gain a +10-foot status bonus to their Speed, and take a –1 penalty to AC. The recon scout can't use concentrate actions except @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} and rage actions. The rage lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies the recon scout can perceive, or until the recon scout falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. Once the rage ends, the recon scout can't Rage again for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feat-effects.Item.z3uyCMBddrPK5umr]{Effect: Rage}

Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
Sudden Charge.description: The recon scout Strides twice and makes a melee Strike.

Elite Smokesight Prowler Wight.name: Elite Smokesight Prowler Wight

Smoke Vision.name: Smoke Vision
Smoke Vision.description: The prowler wight ignores the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} condition from smoke.

Final Spite.description:
Trigger The prowler wight is reduced to 0 Hit Points

Effect The prowler wight makes a Strike before being destroyed. They don't gain any temporary HP from drain life on this Strike.
Final Spite.name: Final Spite

Drain Life.name: Drain Life
Drain Life.description:
When the hunter wight damages a living creature using an unarmed attack or their bound weapon, they gain 10 temporary Hit Points, and the creature must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:27|options:inflicts:drained] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}. Further damage dealt by the hunter wight's unarmed and bound weapon attacks increases the value of the drained condition by 1 on a failed save, to a maximum of drained 4.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.LRIYUFQ7FE9H4RWD]{Effect: Drain Life}

Feign Death.name: Feign Death
Feign Death.description: The prowler wight quenches the telltale red glow in their eye sockets, falls @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and lies completely still. Until the next time they act, the prowler wight appears to be an ordinary corpse. They have an automatic result of 40 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as an ordinary corpse.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The prowler wight deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Spawn Prowler Wight.name: Spawn Prowler Wight
Spawn Prowler Wight.description: A living humanoid killed by a prowler wight's weapon or claw Strike rises as a hunter wight spawn after [[/gmr 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}. This spawn is under the command of the prowler wight that killed them. They don't have drain life or spawn prowler wight and are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 2} for as long as they're a prowler wight spawn. If the creator of the prowler wight spawn dies, the prowler wight spawn becomes a fully autonomous prowler wight; they regain their free will, gain drain life and spawn prowler wight, and are no longer clumsy

Elite Smokesight Prowler Wight.publicNotes:
Often found lurking in the dark, prowler wights wield subterfuge as their greatest weapon. They frequently feign death in old sewers, graveyards, and mausoleums, waiting for hapless victims to pass by before striking.

Wights are undead beings of spite who primarily stalk places related to death.

Shadow Cannon.hazarddescription: A cannon built of cast iron and infused with shadow magic, mounted on the side of Aslynn's flying ship.
Shadow Cannon.routine: (1 action) The cannon fires a blast that contains as many PCs as possible, choosing randomly in the event of a tie.
Shadow Cannon.name: Shadow Cannon
Shadow Cannon.disable: @Check[arcana|dc:20] or @Check[thievery|dc:20] on the cannon's body to deactivate

Load the Cannons.name: Load the Cannons
Load the Cannons.description:
Trigger The ship flies within 30 feet of Star

Effect The cannon rolls initiative.

Pappy Draighean (5-6).name: Pappy Draighean (5-6)
Pappy Draighean (5-6).publicNotes:
Leprechauns are mostly jovial tricksters who prefer mischief over conflict. They fill their days with as much fun, wine, and food as possible. Mostly found in forested regions, leprechauns respect nature and those who protect it.

Leprechauns do not attack on sight. Rather, they engage in conversation and try to charm, cajole, or trick those they meet into doing favors for them or freely giving over a treasured item, usually in return for illusory wealth or false promises of wealth and success. These small tricksters are masters at discerning the desires of those they meet-a knack that puts them in a powerful position when bargaining for goods or favors. They aren't above turning people against each other for their own benefit but generally not to an extent that causes harm.

In most cases, a leprechaun doesn't keep a purloined possession for long. The leprechaun most often returns such stolen prizes just in time to defuse tensions, often as they point out the humor of the situation, hoping to share their amusement and mirth with the victim. In cases where a leprechaun's trick goes too far and results in an incensed victim, the leprechaun quickly flees the conflict rather than engage in combat. This willingness to return stolen goods or to flee from battles fades as leprechauns grow older. Ancient leprechauns who have lived for thousands of years often spiral into dark bitterness and increasingly use their powers and illusions to lure those who offend them or fail to appreciate a joke into danger... or even death.

Create Object.name: Create Object
Create Object.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The leprechaun produces an item out of their hat, from behind their jacket, from within a hole in a tree stump, or from any other unexpected location. This conjured item must be no more than 1 Bulk and must be made of relatively commonplace material (such as cloth, wood, stone, or even low-value metal like iron or lead). It can't rely on intricate artistry or complex moving parts, never fulfills a Cost or the like, and can't be made of precious materials or materials with a rarity of uncommon or higher.

The created object is temporary and lasts for 1 hour or until the leprechaun creates a new item, whichever comes first.

Leprechaun Magic.name: Leprechaun Magic
Leprechaun Magic.description: When a leprechaun uses their innate spells to deceive, trick, or humiliate a creature, the spell DC increases to 24 and the attack modifier to +15.

Bugbear Slasher.name: Bugbear Slasher
Bugbear Slasher.publicNotes: These stealthy and cruel goblinoid creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaks of boards to build lurking dread and arouse suspicion and fear.

Twin Feint.name: Twin Feint
Twin Feint.description: The bugbear slasher makes a dazzling series of attacks with two weapons, using the first attack to throw their foe off guard against a second attack at a different angle. They make one Strike with each of their two melee weapons, both against the same target. The target is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the second attack. Apply the bugbear slasher's multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

Spellstrike.name: Spellstrike
Spellstrike.description: Nathatel channels a spell into a melee attack to deliver a magically charged attack. He Casts a Spell that takes 1 or 2 actions to cast and requires a spell attack roll. The effects of the spell don't occur immediately but are imbued into his attack instead. He makes a melee Strike with a weapon or unarmed attack, which gains the arcane trait. His spell is coupled with the attack, using his attack roll to determine the effects of both the Strike and the spell. This counts as two attacks for his multiple attack penalty, but the penalty isn't applied until after he has completed the Spellstrike. After he uses Spellstrike, Nathatel can't do so again until he recharges this ability as a single action, which has the concentrate trait. He also recharges his Spellstrike when he casts @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9mPEoOPN0AMuixIv]{Force Fang} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r82rqcm0MmGaBFkM]{Thunderous Strike}.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Rhenei gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Emotion Sense.name: Emotion Sense
Emotion Sense.description: The potted violet etheroot can sense the emotions of creatures within 120 feet as an imprecise sense. Emotion sense is a precise sense against creatures under an emotion effect. A creature under the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} or the serenity effect of the etheroot's Incite Emotion ability can't be noticed via emotion sense.

Soulfired Pot.name: Soulfired Pot
Soulfired Pot.description: The potted violet etheroot is rooted in a soulfired pot, which was glazed within a hellish kiln and which, like normal objects, has Hardness and grants the etheroot resistance to fire. This Hardness reduces any damage the etheroot takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the potted violet etheroot is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its soulfired pot breaks, it loses its resistance to fire, and its AC is reduced to 23. Breaking the pot also increases the etheroot's speed to 25 feet.

Incite Emotion.name: Incite Emotion
Incite Emotion.description:
Requirements The etheroot's last action was a success with a Strike using its stalked bite.

Effect Wounds caused by the potted violet etheroot's stalked bite can create an intense emotional response. The creature damaged by the etheroot's stalked bite is subjected to an effect of the etheroot's choice from the following (@Check[will|dc:22] save; duration 1 minute unless otherwise stated):

  • Despair: Target must attempt a Will save as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Wave of Despair} spell.
  • Fear: Target must attempt a Will save as if targeted by the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4koZzrnMXhhosn0D]{Fear} spell.
  • Hope: Target is affected as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.IAjvwqgiDr3qGYxY]{Courageous Anthem} cantrip and must attempt a Will save to determine duration.

Critical Success The target is affected for 4 rounds.

Success The target is affected for 3 rounds.

Failure The target is affected for 1 round.

Critical Failure The target is unaffected.

  • Serenity: Target must attempt a Will save as if subjected to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.b515AZlB0sridKSq]{Calm} spell.

Tentacle Flurry.description: The potted violet etheroot makes two Strikes with two different tentacles, each limb targeting a different creature. This counts as two attacks toward the etheroot's multiple attack penalty for further actions, but the penalty doesn't increase until after both attacks are made.
Tentacle Flurry.name: Tentacle Flurry

Shadow Blend.name: Shadow Blend
Shadow Blend.description: The shadow drake's form shifts and blends reflexively with surrounding shadows. A shadow drake gains an additional reaction each round, but it can use this reaction only for Shadow Evade.

Shadow Evade.name: Shadow Evade
Shadow Evade.description:
Trigger A creature attacks the shadow drake while it is in an area of dim light

Effect The shadow drake further obscures its position. The attacker must succeed at a @Check[flat|dc:11] check in order to affect the shadow drake, as if the drake were @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} for the triggering attack.

Draconic Frenzy.description: The shadow drake makes one bite Strike and two tail Strikes in any order.
Draconic Frenzy.name: Draconic Frenzy

Shadow Breath.name: Shadow Breath
Shadow Breath.description:
A shadow drake spits a ball of black liquid that explodes into a cloud of frigid black shadow. This attack has a range of 40 feet and explodes in a @Template[burst|distance:5]{5-foot-radius burst}. Creatures within the burst take @Damage[(3d6-4)[cold]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:16|basic|options:area-effect] save). The explosion of shadow also snuffs out mundane light sources the size of a torch, lantern, or smaller, and attempts to counteract magical light with a [[/r 1d20+10 #Counteract Light]]{+10} counteract modifier.

The shadow drake can't use Shadow Breath again for [[/gmr 1d6 #Recharge Shadow Breath]] rounds.

Speed Surge.name: Speed Surge
Speed Surge.description:
Frequency three times per day

Effect The shadow drake Strides or Flies twice.

Growling Shadow Drake.name: Growling Shadow Drake
Growling Shadow Drake.publicNotes: Shadow drakes are typically among the smallest and least powerful of their species. Most stand as tall and long as house cats and have charcoal-colored scales and membranous wings just translucent enough to pass for shadows. Attracted to shiny materials, they employ deception, teamwork, and even rudimentary traps to create opportunities to make off with ill-gotten gains. Shadow drakes have a particular fascination and admiration for umbral dragons-a notable exception to the norm for drakes and dragons.

Fey-Touched Great Wolf.name: Fey-Touched Great Wolf

Sudden Charge.name: Sudden Charge
Sudden Charge.description: The great wolf Strides twice and makes a melee Strike.

Tickle Bite.name: Tickle Bite
Tickle Bite.description: The fey-touched great wolf makes a jaws Strike. If successful, after taking the normal damage from the Strike, the target must succeed at a @Check[will|dc:22] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute as it becomes overcome with fits of laughter.

Topiary.name: Topiary
Topiary.description: Until the next time it acts, the fey-touched great wolf appears to be a topiary in the shape of a wolf. It has an automatic result of 37 on Deception checks and DCs to pass as a bush.

Worry.name: Worry
Worry.description:
Requirements The great wolf has a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} with its jaws

Effect The great wolf shakes the grabbed creature with its teeth, dealing @Damage[(2d8+4)[piercing]] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic] save).

Fey-Touched Great Wolf.publicNotes:
Much larger and more foul-tempered than their common cousins, dire wolves haunt primeval lands that accommodate their massive size and proportionately large hunting grounds and appetites. Orcs are fond of using dire wolves as mounts, finding their vicious tempers perfect for hunting and warfare.

Wolves roam forests, hills, and other wild lands, where they hunt in packs to beleaguer and surround their prey before going in for the kill. Like most predatory animals, wolves prefer to attack the weakest or most vulnerable prey they can find.

Release Rakshasa.name: Release Rakshasa
Release Rakshasa.description:
Trigger The mirror breaks

Effect The mirror releases a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-monster-core.Actor.nFhAJSpbJz1w71EU]{Raktavarna} rakshasa. The raktavarna rolls initiative and remains for 3 rounds, after which the spell ends and the rakshasa disappears. The summoned raktavarna can use 3 actions each round and can use reactions, unlike most summoned creatures.

Fiend's Luck.name: Fiend's Luck
Fiend's Luck.description:
Trigger Fasiel is within 100 feet, this is the closest intact wicked reflections hazard, and a hostile creature's action would cause Fasiel to gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused}, controlled, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, petrified, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}, slowed, stunned, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} condition or would deal 20+ damage to Fasiel

Effect The mirror breaks and disrupts the action.

Wicked Reflection.name: Wicked Reflection
Wicked Reflection.disable: @Check[stealth|dc:21] (trained) to approach a mirror without showing up in the reflection, followed by @Check[thievery|dc:19] to cover mirror or dispel magic (2nd level; counteract DC 19) to counteract the binding
Wicked Reflection.hazarddescription: Ornate full-length mirrors with fiendish filigree depict the image of Fasiel ibn Sazadin in villainous triumph over his enemies.

Accursed Claws.name: Accursed Claws
Accursed Claws.description: Sounrel's claws carry her mother's hag magic. When she critically hits with a claw Strike, the target takes an additional @Damage[1d4[persistent,mental]] damage.

Overburden.name: Overburden
Overburden.description:
Requirements The infested clockwork heap's last action was a success with an infested touch Strike

Effect A fragment of the infesting spirit attaches to the target's clothing or armor, making the creature encumbered. The encumbered condition from Overburden disappears when the infested clockwork is destroyed or after 10 minutes, whichever comes first.

Scrap Tempest.name: Scrap Tempest
Scrap Tempest.description: The infested clockwork heap unleashes a cloud of loosely connected debris that whirls around its body at incredible speed. Each creature within @Template[emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} takes @Damage[3d8[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[fortitude|dc:25|basic|options:area-effect]).

Undead Nathatel.name: Undead Nathatel

Magic Sense.name: Magic Sense
Magic Sense.description: Nathatel detects all sources of magic within 30 feet as an imprecise sense.

Undead Nathatel.publicNotes:
Rarely, the bones of a spellcaster can be used to create a skeleton that retains a limited ability to cast spells. These spells are almost always offensive in nature, and the skeletal mage uses them with reckless abandon. Skeletal mages are often misidentified as liches, and while not nearly as cunning or deadly, they still pose a significant threat to their foes.

Among the ranks of the dead, none are so numerous, nor so varied, as the skeleton. While most are almost entirely made from bone, some maintain a few scraps of flesh to aid them in movement, such as wing membranes.

Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
Bardic Lore.description: Revna can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +9 modifier.

Pups.name: Pups
Pups.publicNotes: Bonds of loyalty that endure beyond death reanimate pets to crawl from their graves within days of dying, returning to the side of their past owners, family, or pack. Unfortunately, death irrevocably changes a risen pet. They return as aggressive, predatory beasts, difficult to control and easy to anger. Even the most friendly and docile of pets becomes sadistic and violent in undeath—fixating first on those it views as competition for the attention of its owners. When a risen pet is jilted, rebuffed, or offended by its owner, it turns on them.

Sense Companion.name: Sense Companion
Sense Companion.description: Pups knows the direction of its past owner or family (as long as they're both on the same plane), but not the distance.

Stench.name: Stench
Stench.description: 10 feet. A creature entering the aura or starting its turn in the aura must succeed at a @Check[fortitude|dc:14] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (plus @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for as long as it's sickened on a critical failure). While within the aura, affected creatures take a -2 circumstance penalty to saves against disease and to recover from the sickened condition. A creature that succeeds at its save is temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Betray the Living.name: Betray the Living
Betray the Living.description: Pups' Strikes deal 1d4 additional damage to living creatures.

Caustic Drool.name: Caustic Drool
Caustic Drool.description:
Caustic saliva drips from the warhound's mouth. Until the end of its turn, the abyssal warhound's jaws Strike deals an additional 2 points of acid damage on a successful attack, or 4 points on a critical success.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.5M3RGpOuxizPM5Iy]{Effect: Caustic Drool}

Hunting Call.name: Hunting Call
Hunting Call.description: The pack leader throws its head back and lets out a bone-chilling howl. All abyssal warhounds and pack leaders with 30 feet that hear the call immediately activate their Caustic Drool ability as a free action. A creature that benefits from this effect becomes immune to this creature's call for one minute.

Shake.name: Shake
Shake.description:
Requirements The abyssal warhound's Caustic Drool ability is active

Effect The warhound shakes its head, splattering nearby creatures with caustic saliva. All creatures within 10 feet of the warhound take @Damage[3d4[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:19|basic]). Abyssal warhounds are immune to this damage.

Warning Growl.name: Warning Growl
Warning Growl.description:
Trigger A creature targets the warhound with a melee Strike

Effect The warhound @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralizes} the triggering creature and does not take a penalty for not speaking a language. The results of this check occur before resolving the triggering Strike.

prototypeToken.name: House Spirits With an Absurd Number of Regenerating Pies

House Spirits With an Absurd Number of R.name: House Spirits With an Absurd Number of Regenerating Pies
House Spirits With an Absurd Number of R.hazarddescription: A group of house spirits run around the lunchroom hurling pies at the walls and all the people in the room—and then the pies magically reconstitute and throw themselves again.
House Spirits With an Absurd Number of R.hp: if the house spirits take this much damage, they aren't killed, but they do flee the school and don't return
House Spirits With an Absurd Number of R.disable: @Check[diplomacy|dc:23], @Check[deception|dc:23], or @Check[intimidation|dc:23] four times to convince the spirits to undo their spells, @Check[arcana|dc:21] or @Check[occultism|dc:21] to unravel a pie's enchantments, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (2nd rank; counteract DC 18) to undo one pies' worth of spells. Three successes are required to disable the hazard.

Sur-Pies.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room

Effect A pie from the room magically hurls itself at the creature and attempts a pie Strike, then the hazard rolls initiative.
Sur-Pies.name: Sur-Pies

Continually Sur-piesed.name: Continually Sur-piesed
Continually Sur-piesed.description:
Trigger A creature enters the room, attempts an action with the concentrate trait for the first time this turn, or ends their turn

Effect The hazard makes a pie Strike against the triggering creature.

House Spirits With an Absurd Number of R.routine: (4 actions) The hazard regenerates any pies that it has thrown at a cost of one action per pie (to a maximum of 4 active pies). Each successful check to disable the hazard deactivates one of the pies, reducing the number of active pies by 1. After regenerating pies on its turn, the hazard throws pies whenever a creature triggers continually sur-piesed. For each pie Strike, roll [[/r 1d4]]. On a 1, the pie pan has nails driven into it by Numblekin and deals an additional @Damage[(2d8+7)[piercing]] damage. The nails make the pie's damage lethal, rather than nonlethal.

Bugbear Raider.name: Bugbear Raider
Bugbear Raider.publicNotes:
The bugbear tormentor seeks to torture their prey as much through psychological intimidation as through physical harm. The longer a bugbear tormentor can keep their victim alive and terrified, the better they feel.

These stealthy and cruel goblinoid creatures delight in spreading fear and tormenting their victims. Bugbears are the monsters lurking in the closet and hiding under the bed. Preying on remote farmsteads, bugbears reveal their presence with thumps in the night or creaks of boards to build lurking dread and arouse suspicion and fear.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: The bugbear tormentor deals 1d6 extra precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Twin Feint.name: Twin Feint
Twin Feint.description: The bugbear raider makes a dazzling series of attacks with two weapons, using the first attack to throw their foe off guard against a second attack at a different angle. They make one Strike with each of their two melee weapons, both against the same target. The target is automatically @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the second attack. Apply the bugbear radier's multiple attack penalty to the Strikes normally.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Thisnabel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Thisnabel deals an extra 1d4 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Transformed Bremix (9-10).name: Transformed Bremix (9-10)
Transformed Bremix (9-10).publicNotes:
Skelms crave power, and the palace skelms who stalk the halls where such power concentrates are among the most dangerous of their kind. They assume titles that allow them maximum freedom to punish or hurt others with minimal oversight: any vindictive guard captain, tyrannical viceroy, or needlessly cruel magistrate could be or become a palace skelm. They delight in the wealth and status of their positions, garbing themselves in ornate finery that reflects their station.

Palace skelms ingratiate themselves with powerful individuals and gather followers by stoking fears of losing long-held or hard-earned power-especially power gained through illicit means. They undermine their enemies by encouraging competition, jealousy, and outright paranoia by way of magic and false messages. These skelms possess an unnatural ability to twist spoken words and worm their manipulative magic into others' speech, sowing confusion and hatred that might explode into violence.

A political upheaval is a palace skelm's greatest fear and opportunity alike, upsetting the balance of power he has built but providing countless new opportunities to sow hatred and evil. This conflicting goal leads palace skelms to self-sabotage and undermine their own efforts more than any other skelm.

Rage-filled skelms are drawn to any settlement with more than a few hundred souls. Using magical disguises and leveraging societal norms to their benefit, these antlered monsters crave fearful respect and brutally punish any who dare disagree with their lofty opinions, even in the slightest degree. Although quite dangerous on their own, skelms are at their deadliest when leading an angry mob. Their cruel and exploitative nature has made their name synonymous with villainy.

An existing skelm can transform any evil humanoid who's overwhelmed with rage into one of their kind. Skelms heap enraging humiliation on potential new brothers as a form of indoctrination, convincing these recruits that some other person or group is responsible for their misery. This practice ensures skelms begin their new existence with sufficient vitriol to plot their revenge.

Many newly forged skelms carry on their lives in the roles they held as mortals; and in fact, these roles often shape the type of skelm they become. Skelms can arise among members of nearly any ancestry, though they're more common among cultures with deeply entrenched gender roles, unjust hierarchies, and those that don't offer healthy ways to experience and process anger.
Transformed Bremix (9-10).allSaves: -2 to all saves vs. emotion effects

-2 to All Saves vs. Emotion Effects.name: -2 to All Saves vs. Emotion Effects

Bully the Departed.name: Bully the Departed
Bully the Departed.description:
The skelm draws upon the spirit of one of his deceased victims, tormenting their soul beyond the grave. Until the end of his next turn, the soul skelm gains regeneration 15 (deactivated by force or good), and he deals an extra @Damage[1d8[spirit]] damage on his Strikes.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.gHczZWA34WQx4px0]{Effect: Bully the Departed}

Change Shape.name: Change Shape
Change Shape.description:
The soul skelm can take on the appearance of any Medium male humanoid. This doesn't change his Speed or his attack and damage bonuses with his Strikes but might change the damage type his Strikes deal.

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

Isolating Lash.name: Isolating Lash
Isolating Lash.description: The soul skelm makes a melee Strike trailing a wave of shadowy illusions. The skelm is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of his next turn. If the Strike is successful, the skelm increases the number of damage dice by one, and the target must attempt a @Check[will|dc:29] save. On a failure, the target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible}, inaudible, and otherwise imperceptible to its allies for 4 rounds, and it likewise can't see, hear, or otherwise perceive those allies. Regardless of the outcome, the creature is temporarily immune to Isolating Lash for 24 hours.

Bardic Lore.name: Bardic Lore
Bardic Lore.description: Revna can Recall Knowledge on any subject with a +9 modifier.

Steady Spellcasting.name: Steady Spellcasting
Steady Spellcasting.description: If a reaction would disrupt Revna's spellcasting action, she attempts a @Check[flat|dc:15]. If she succeeds, her action isn't disrupted.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Rhenei gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Ambush Raider.name: Ambush Raider
Ambush Raider.publicNotes:
Great treasure awaits those willing to explore the hazardous depths of the world's ancient tombs and forgotten dungeons. Some tomb raiders seek riches of bygone eras; others recover pieces of history thought lost to the sands of time.

The world is a wide, open place fraught with peril and adventure. Explorers use their knowledge of nature and survival skills to see every corner of the land.

Hazard Spotter.name: Hazard Spotter
Hazard Spotter.description: The tomb raider automatically attempts a secret Perception check to notice a hazard when they are within 10 feet of the hazard.

Trick Attack.name: Trick Attack
Trick Attack.description: The tomb raider musters their guile to attempt a clever attack that catches their foe unprepared. The tomb raider chooses one of their weapons. The next attack with that weapon deals an extra 2d6 precision damage. In addition, the tomb raider can Interact to draw the weapon (or to reload it if they choose the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.XyA6PKV46aNlLXOd]{Hand Crossbow}).

Fireball Rune.name: Fireball Rune
Fireball Rune.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:22] (expert) to erase the rune without triggering the sensor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (3rd rank; counteract DC 20) to counteract the rune
Fireball Rune.hazarddescription: An invisible rune creates an invisible, spherical magical sensor with a 20-foot radius.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the sensor area

Effect The rune detonates a fireball centered on the triggering creature's square. This is a 3rd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} spell that deals @Damage[6d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:22|basic]).

Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess
Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger Halran critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with hisAldori dueling sword.

Effect Halran attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of his Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Halran take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand his language.

Aldori Parry.name: Aldori Parry
Aldori Parry.description: Thisnabel gains a +2 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn.

Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
Sneak Attack.description: Thisnabel deals an extra 1d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Brinna.name: Brinna
Brinna.publicNotes:
Most smaller communities have at least one smithy where locals and travelers can have horses shod or equipment repaired. Larger settlements and cities often have a variety of smiths, many specializing in blacksmithing, weapon smithing, armor smithing, or even smelting coins in a mint. The smith is a 6th-level challenge when competing with smithing or other crafting tasks.

Every settlement needs tradespeople to create new products, facilitate commerce, and keep the infrastructure from crumbling. Larger cities often have entire guilds dedicated to the creation of specific goods, managing worker conditions, and working with local governments.

Smith's Fury.name: Smith's Fury
Smith's Fury.description: The smith deals an additional 1d6 damage when they hit with a weapon they created.

Change Size.name: Change Size
Change Size.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Farah changes a creature's size. This works as a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wzctak6BxOW8xvFV]{Enlarge} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.PjhUmyKnq6K5uDby]{Shrink} spell but can target an unwilling creature (@Check[fortitude|dc:25] save negates).

Bravery.name: Bravery
Bravery.description: Whenever Farah rolls a success at a Will save against a fear effect, she gets a critical success instead. In addition, any time she gains the frightened condition, she reduces its value by 1

Burning Grasp.name: Burning Grasp
Burning Grasp.description: When Farah grabs a creature, that creature takes @Damage[1d6[fire]] damage, and takes 1d6 fire damage at the end of each of its turns as long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Combat Grab.name: Combat Grab
Combat Grab.description:
Requirements Farah has one hand free

Effect Farah makes a melee Strike while keeping one hand free. If the Strike hits, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} in Farah's free hand.

Farah Al-Saleel (5-6).name: Farah Al-Saleel (5-6)
Farah Al-Saleel (5-6).publicNotes:
The efreet are hateful and merciless genies from the Plane of Fire, where they build metropolises and massive trade centers that draw extraplanar travelers from across the multiverse. They are cruel slavers, vengeful warmongers, and sinister wish-masters; there are many tales of mortals who made pacts with efreet only to have their words twisted to suit a genie's capricious and malevolent whims.

Efreet do not readily treat with other genies; they share an eternal feud with the djinn, disdain marids, regard jann as weaklings unworthy of the genie title, and only occasionally tolerate alliances with shaitans. At 12 feet tall and weighing 2,000 pounds, efreet are formidable opponents and cow their chosen victims with a glance.

A unique type of genie exists for each Elemental Plane, and the bodies of genies are formed out of elemental matter corresponding to their native plane: djinn are formed from wind, clouds, and storms; efreet are fire made flesh; marids are beings of water; and shaitans are composed of metal, gems, and stone. Lastly, the jann are formed out of all four elements, and are the weakest of geniekind.

Suhko (1-2).name: Suhko (1-2)
Suhko (1-2).allSaves: +2 circumstance to all saves vs. dream and sleep

+2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Dream a.name: +2 Circumstance to All Saves vs. Dream and Sleep

Familiar (Runt).name: Familiar (Runt)
Familiar (Runt).description: Suhko has a Tiny prairie drake named Runt as a familiar. Runt has a speed of 25 feet, a burrow speed of 20 feet, 5 hit points, an AC of 16, and the following additional familiar abilities: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.Q42nrq9LwDdbeZM5]{Restorative Familiar} and speech (Common). Note that as normal for a minion, Suhko must spend 1 action to command Runt to give him the 2 actions needed to use Restorative Familiar.

Restorative Familiar.name: Restorative Familiar
Restorative Familiar.description:
Frequency once per day

Effect Runt gives up some of his animating energy and heals Suhko. He must be in Suhko's space to do so. Runt restores @Damage[1d8[healing]]{1d8 Hit Points} to Suhko.

Note Suhko must spend 1 action to command Runt to give him the 2 actions needed to use Restorative Familiar.

Elite Cave Bear (PFS 4-07).name: Elite Cave Bear (PFS 4-07)

Mauler.name: Mauler
Mauler.description: The bear gains a +4 circumstance bonus to damage rolls against creatures it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}.

Rush.name: Rush
Rush.description: The cave bear Strides and makes a Strike at the end of that movement. During the Stride, it gains a +10-foot circumstance bonus to its Speed.

Elite Cave Bear (PFS 4-07).publicNotes:
Larger, stronger, and far more aggressive than its smaller cousins, the cave bear is a behemoth that avoids civilized lands, preferring to dwell in remote places. As its name might suggest, the cave bear makes its den in natural caves, and like the grizzly bear, a cave bear is fiercely territorial. Unlike a grizzly bear, however, a cave bear is short tempered and will make sure its foe is dead before moving on, usually feasting on its prey's soft flesh once it has been incapacitated. Cave bears are often regarded as powerful guardian spirits by remote-dwelling people, while they are utilized as beasts of war by orcs or even giants-stone giants in particular have an affinity for keeping trained cave bears as pets or guardians for their homes.

Bears are ferocious predators typically found in cold or temperate woodlands and hills. Many species of bear exist in addition to the two presented below, such as the smaller (but no less dangerous) black bear or the arctic-dwelling polar bear.

Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess
Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger Halran critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with hisAldori dueling sword.

Effect Halran attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of his Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Halran take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand his language.

Greater Fireball Rune.name: Greater Fireball Rune
Greater Fireball Rune.disable: @Check[thievery|dc:25] (expert) to erase the rune without triggering the sensor, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic} (4th rank; counteract DC 23) to counteract the rune
Greater Fireball Rune.hazarddescription: An invisible rune creates an invisible, spherical magical sensor with a 20-foot radius.

Fireball.name: Fireball
Fireball.description:
Trigger A living creature enters the sensor area

Effect The rune detonates a fireball centered on the triggering creature's square. This is a 4th-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.sxQZ6yqTn0czJxVd]{Fireball} spell that deals @Damage[8d6[fire]] damage (@Check[reflex|dc:25|basic]).

Unnerving Prowess.name: Unnerving Prowess
Unnerving Prowess.description:
Trigger Dura critically succeeds at a Strike or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} with her Aldori dueling sword.

Effect Dura attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the target of her Strike or Disarm. This Demoralize attempt does not have the auditory trait, nor does Dura take a penalty to the check if the target doesn't understand her language.

Shaitan Tactics (3-4).name: Shaitan Tactics (3-4)
Shaitan Tactics (3-4).disable: @Check[arcana|dc:20] (trained) or @Check[nature|dc:20] (trained) to contest the shaitan's control (requires two successes).
Shaitan Tactics (3-4).hazarddescription: The shaitan observes the area from a distance, observing the battlefield as a game board. The ground trembles in response to the genie's enthusiasm.
Shaitan Tactics (3-4).routine: (2 actions) On each of the trap's actions, the trap either moves a willing creature on the ground up to 30 feet without provoking reactions or makes a hostile creature on the ground @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round on a failed @Check[acrobatics|dc:20] check or @Check[reflex|dc:20] save.
Shaitan Tactics (3-4).reset: The trap deactivates and resets once all hostile creatures leave A3 or surrender.

Opening Move.name: Opening Move
Opening Move.description:
Trigger The shaitan sees a non-genie creature threatening an ally

Effect The trap rolls initiative and the shaitan takes control of the floor in A3, making it difficult terrain for hostile creatures while the trap is active.
